Through her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Elizabeth works in a small business selling beauty products, clothes and sweets and she also has sound equipment that she hire out for various events and parties.  Elizabeth works every day for around ten hours.  Elizabeth likes her work and she believes it is going well for her because of her good prices and the friendly service that she offers to customers.

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support provided, she will be able to buy professional sound equipment to hire out for events, barbeques, children's parties and more.  That way, Elizabeth will be able to have another source of income.  Elizabeth will continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her big dream of have a safe home and to provide her family with good well-being.

loans.use: to buy professional sound equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like wood, glue, foam, and fabric.

loans.name: Yorman Alexander

texts.es:
Yorman es un joven emprendedor y con un futuro promisorio. Sus ganas de salir adelante le han permitido alcanzar grandes logros en su vida. Hoy cuenta con su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas, labor que le permite generar los recursos necesarios para colaborarle a su madre y pagarse sus estudios. Sueña en convertirse en un gran microempresario y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas. 
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus ventas y aumentar el número de clientes, con el objeto de montar en un futuro próximo un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Yorman is a young entrepreneur with a promising outlook. His will to succeed has helped him achieve great goals in life. He has today a fast-food business and this is how he receives an income, helps his mother and pays for his studies. His dream is to become a micro entrepreneur and this is why he is requesting a loan to invest in supplies needed to prepare the food he sells.

His biggest dream is to improve his sales and attract more customers, so that he can open a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La clienta Maria vive en Guayaquil. Empezó con un proyecto de comenzar un negocio para tener mas ingresos viajando a Perú a comprar ropa (ya que la ropa en Perú es mucho mas económica que en Ecuador) poco a poco en viajes comenzó a tener clientela. 

Su dificultad en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde ella vende la ropa.Tiene dos niños los cuales estudian en escuela fiscales. 

Con el préstamo  va a comprar  tela y faldas para poder incrementar su mercadería. Su sueño es tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Guayaquil.  She embarked on a project to start a business so that she could have more income.  Maria travels to Peru in order to buy clothing since the products over there are much less expensive than they are in Ecuador.  Through her trips, she gradually began gaining customers.  

Her difficulty with her business is dealing with the crime that exists in the area where she sells clothes.  Maria has two children who are studying at state schools.  With this loan, she will buy fabrics and skirts so that she can increase her inventory.  Her dream is to have her own shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy skirts and fabrics.

loans.name: Manuel Rodrigo

texts.es:
El cliente Manuel vive en Guayaquil. El comenzó por que la mamá lo mando a que aprenda la profesión de confesionista poco a poco le fue gustando ese oficio.  Hasta que ya en la actualidad el realiza el trabajo solo  y en diferentes horarios ya que los pedidos los tiene que entregar en un tiempo establecido.

Su dificultad es la enfermedad  de la esposa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar maquinas y implemento. 

Su sueño es hacer cuartos de alquile, mejorar el negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mejores maquinas y poder viajar a otras provincias para vender lo que el confecciona que es ropa de hombres y mujeres.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Guayaquil.  He started because his mother sent him to learn the tailoring profession.  Little by little he started liking this trade.  He now works alone and on different schedules.  This is because he has to deliver the orders that he has at an established time.

His difficulty is his wife’s illness.  He wants to use the loan to buy machines and sewing implements.

His dream is to make rooms to rent and to improve his business.  He wants to use the loan to buy better machines and to be able to travel to other provinces to sell.  He makes men’s and women’s clothing.

loans.use: to buy machines and sewing implements.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia tiene 34 años es casada tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 15 años, que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida ella vende pollo frito Pacumuto tiene su puesto de venta   que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  La señora Alicia es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La señora Alicia les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un frizer y mesas y sillas para brindar comodidad a su clientes, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Alicia is 34, married, and has two children ages 8 and 15 who are in school. She sells a fried chicken dish called Pacumuto. Her stall is located in El Torno. Alicia is a very hard-working person who, with dedication, has acquired stability and solvency bit by bit. She has also gained popularity; she is very well-known because she provides very kind customer service. With the money from this loan, she will purchase a freezer and tables and chairs for her customers' comfort. She tells us that she will be able to expand her business more with a lot of hard work. She will be able to keep building a heritage for her family's well-being, as well as for her personal well-being. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and tables.

loans.name: Mauro Julio

texts.es:
Mauro es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Mauro no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mauro trabaja en su pequeño negocio de vulcanizado y soldadura, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.

Mauro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la renovación de sus herramientas y mantenimiento de sus equipos de trabajo, de esta manera Mauro podrá seguir brindando sus servicios, así pues poco a poco el desea poder lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda completa a de servicios de vulcanizado, soldadura, venta de repuestos y lubricantes.
texts.en:
Mauro is a 33-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and 3 children whom he loves and who are his principal reason for living. He is a very likable, hard-working, and enthusiastic person and, alongside his wife, dedicates all his efforts to advancing his family. Lamentably, for lack of economic resources, and due to necessities, he has had to work from a very early age. Mauro was unable to study for the professional mechanic career he desired. In his spare time, he likes to cook a rich “Chicken Escabeche” to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with great effort and dedication, Mauro works in his small tire repair and welding business. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that he is doing well, due to his experience and the kind treatment he offers others. 

Mauro is very grateful to Kiva investors, since thanks to the help they offer, he will be able to renovate his tools and maintain his working equipment. In this manner, Mauro can continue offering his services, and, then, little by little, he wishes to achieve his grand dream of having a complete store and service center for vulcanization, welding, and selling replacement parts and lubricants.

loans.use: to renovate his tools and maintain equipment in his small tire repair and welding shop.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ms. Ramzana is a 46-year-old, married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her five children. 

To make her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.  In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She has been in association with Kashf for four years. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has four children and a total of six members in her home, and her husband is the only earner of the family.

It was very tough for Samina to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband, so she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose, she started her business of cloth trading as she bought cloths of different varieties from Lahore and Faisalabad market and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family.

In order to inflate her sales, she applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more varieties of cloths in different colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of cloths in different colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia Brigida vive en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores y la venta de jora de chicha,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia Brigida solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Brigida lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  She still has her business raising small animals and selling jora de chicha, a corn liquor.  She has had her business for years and it is doing well because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep working so he can keep supporting her family. 

Brigida is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. 

She is thankful for the loan she has been offered and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth vive en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco,la socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores y comestibles,la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a sus negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia Yaneth solicita el credito para la compra de aceites y sacos de arroz para su negocio de venta de comestibles.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yaneth lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  She belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank.  She still has her business raising small animals and selling groceries.  She has had her businesses for a while and they are doing well because of the effort she puts into them every day, which is how she is getting her family ahead. 

Yaneth is asking for a loan to buy oils and bags of rice for her business selling groceries.

She is thankful to those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oils and bags of rice for her grocery business

loans.name: Letty Leonor

texts.es:
La cliente Letty vive en Machala (provincia enriquesida de cultivos), comenzó su negocio cuando le refirieron que el cultivo de ají y otros productos orgánicos eran muy buenos para vender y que le iban alquilar hectarias de tierra para poder cultivar. Poco a poco cultivando y vendiendo el cultivo de aji pudo tener capital para poder tener un mayor sembrado. 

En la actualidad sigue con su negocio. La cliente Letty cultiva el aji y lo vende por quintal. Una de sus dificultades es para trasportar su cultivo. Tiene una niña que estudia en una escuela particular. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas para su hija ya que quiere que este bien de salud para cuando comience las clases. En el futuro tiene muchas aspiraciones por eso quiere seguir con su negocio y que su hija este muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
Letty lives in Machala (a province enriched by crops).  She started her business when she was told that chili pepper crops and other organic products were very good to sell, and they were going to rent her hectares of land for her to be able to farm.

Little by little she was cultivating the land and selling the chili pepper crop.  She was able to have capital in order to be able to have more plants.  She now continues with her business.  Letty grows the chili peppers, and she sells them by the ‘quintal’ [weight measurement equal to 100 kilograms].  

One of her difficulties is transporting her crop.  She has a daughter who attends a private school.

She wants to use the loan to buy medicines for her daughter because she wants her to be in good health when classes start.  She has many aspirations for the future.  Therefore, she wants to continue with her business.  She also wants her daughter to be in very good health.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Sacsayhuaman Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Hayde ella es soltera tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia  vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de imprenta, producción de pinturas, muñequería, artesanía, producción de niños (artesanía.)
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sacsayhuaman Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Hayde, is 51 years old and single and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling food in one of the markets in the city of Cusco.  She has been in this business for years.  Her business is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to continue working so she can continue helping her family.

Haydee's requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as oil, rice, and others.

The businesses of the other members are printing, painting, doll-making, and handicrafts.

The group member in the bottom right could not be at the group loan meeting because she was working.

Haydee's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil and rice

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SALUD; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.
La socia Mónica tiene 45 años de edad ,02 hijos y es casada, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares, que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como perfumes para damas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, venta de productos naturales, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, docentes y trabajadores de empresas privadas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mónica belongs to the communal bank Salud, which is located in the district of Wanchaq, in Cusco province, department of Cusco. She is 45 years old and is married with two children. This member alternates her daily activities with her business selling beauty supplies like perfume, fragrances, creams, and other products. She sells door-to-door among friends and family members who request her products. She has been in this business for several years and it is going well because of the daily effort she puts into her work. This member is a responsible and dedicated person, and her business supports her family. She is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise like women's fragrances.

The other members work renting rooms, selling natural products, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, teaching, and as private company employees.

The members who appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late at the meeting for work-related issues.

Mónica is grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with the terms of her payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like women's fragrances.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Amparo, de 52 años madre soltera de dos hijos, uno es mayor e independiente y otra aún está en la universidad a quien ayuda incondicionalmente para su desarrollo, el nivel académico de doña Amparo fue hasta el bachillerato no pudo seguir estudiando  se dedico mas a sus hijos y a su pequeña pulpería con la que suple sus necesidades, siendo el único medio de ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para invertir en la venta con productos básicos para sus clientes quienes son los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Amparo is 52 and the single mother of two children. One is over 18 and independent and the other, whom Amparo supports steadfastly, is still at university. Amparo completed high school and could not continue studying after that. 

She looks after her children and her small grocery store, which she supports herself with, as it is her only source of income. 

The loan she is applying for is to invest in selling basic products to her customers who are neighbours from the area.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, soda, vegetables.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 17, 13 y 7 años, por quienes da la vida y junto a su esposo se esfuerzan mucho para darles una vida digna y sobre todo para hacerlos personas de bien. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido, asimismo encontramos muchos atractivos turísticos como son las Líneas de Nazca, las cuales reciben a infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando Luzmila tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión e especial ver sus novelas y en algunas oportunidades le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Res”. Debido a sus pocos recursos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Luzmila como agricultora, ella trabaja muy duro en su parcela la cual está sembrada de tunas, así como también se dedica a la venta de cochinilla, la cochinilla es un insecto el cual es usado para dar color a diversos productos, en especial textiles, ella trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día, ya que tiene que revisar siempre su cultivo y también verificar si la cochinilla está madurando; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y trabajadora y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Luzmila está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que e sla segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y con ello Luzmila podra Kiva podrá realizar una nueva infestación de cochinilla y dar mantenimiento a su cultivo, en especial abonarlo, regarlo, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener una buena cosecha y mejorara sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante y luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 37 years old. She is the mother of three children, ages 17, 13, and 7, to whom she devotes her life, and together with her husband, she exerts herself greatly to give them a dignified life and above all to make them good people. Her home is located in the city of Nazca, a city characterized by having a very warm climate. Furthermore, we find many tourist attractions [here], such as the Nazca Lines, which receive a myriad of tourists throughout the year. When Luzmila has free time, she very much likes to watch television, especially her soap operas, and sometimes she likes very much to eat one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious "Seco de Res" (cilantro beef stew). Due to her scarce resources, she went only to secondary school, but she very much would have liked to do university studies.

Day after day Luzmila works very hard as a farmer on her parcel of land, which is seeded in cactus [for its fruits], and she also sells cochineal. Cochineal is an insect that is used to give color to various products, especially textiles. She works about 6 hours a day, since she always has to review her crops and also verify that the cochineal is maturing. She believes that things are going very well for her in her business because she is very responsible and hardworking, and above all because she has a great will to advance.

Luzmila is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since this is the second time that they have offered her their support, and with it, Luzmila will be able to complete a new infestation of cochineal and maintain her crops, in particular, to fertilize them with compost and irrigate them, among other tasks. Thus in this way she will be able to have a good harvest and improve her income, which will allow her to continue working and advancing and striving to make her greatest dream a reality: to finish constructing her house.

loans.use: to begin an infestation of cochineal and purchase  compost, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old and the mother of six children, all of whom are currently studying in school. For the last four years, she has earned a living by operating a bicycle repair shop in Mpeketoni, Lamu, where she earns a monthly profit of 17,000 KES.

Alice was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and she is applying for her fourth loan of 60,000 KES to purchase additional tools and equipment such as spanners (wrenches), wheel tubes, lubricants and so on for her business. 

She will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees for her children, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Alice hopes to own her own car garage in future so as to improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional repairing tools and equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Khorsheed

texts.en:
Ms. Khorsheed is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

Khorsheed hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors

loans.name: Dora Angelica

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de broasteria,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 07:00pm, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos,aceite entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She continues with her Broasted chicken business. She has been doing her business for a long time, and it's going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She works from 8 o'clock in the morning to 7 o'clock in the evening, because this way she moves her family forward. 

She is applying for a loan to buy chicken and oil among other things. 

She is happy about the loan and commits to paying the installments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, among other things.

loans.name: Nirgis

texts.en:
Ms. Nirgis is 35 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Nirgis was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Nirgis felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards.

Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders, so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR which she will use to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of thread in various colors.  She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of thread in various colors

loans.name: Marium

texts.en:
Ms. Marium is a 53-year-old, married woman. She has been selling vegetables for the past two years. She is very enthusiastic about her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a mother of two and is striving hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase sacks of vegetables such as onions, potatoes, and ginger. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. She has been in association with Kashf for six years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Marium dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables such as onions, potatoes, and ginger.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 29 juin 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Dienabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 47 ans et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Elle achète de l’arachide décortiquée auprès des villageoises qu’elle transforme en patte pour la revente dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec son crédit, elle compte acheter quatre sacs à 11 000 F CFA le sac. Elle supporte des frais de transformation de 1250 F CFA par sac.

Elle peut obtenir en moyenne des bénéfices nets de 9 000 F CFA tous les dix jours ce qui lui permette d’apporter sa contribution dans les charges de la maison.
texts.en:
Created on June 29, 2008, on the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois, this group is made up of women who are very familiar with the type of program offered by Bancs Villageois.  All the members of this group come from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual support.  Their main activity is small retail business.

Dienabou, (sitting at the far right in the photo, and raising her hand), is the group's featured borrower.  She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of three children, including one girl.  She buys hulled groundnuts from village women and processes these groundnuts into a paste which she resells at weekly markets.

With her loan, Dienabou is planning to buy four bags (of groundnuts) at a price of 11,000 CFA francs per bag.  Processing fees amount to 1,250 CFA francs per bag.

On average, she is able to make a net profit of 9,000 CFA francs every ten days, which allows her to contribute to the household's expenses.

loans.use: to buy four bags of groundnuts worth 11,000 CFA francs per bag, taking into account that processing fees amount to 1250 CFA francs per bag.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Ms. Sakeena is a 55-year-old married woman and has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Sakeena's husband. They have two buffalos in milk and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. They have three children.

They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to reach more people in their community, Sakeena requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo.  They hope to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué de vingt femmes qui habitent le même village et entretiennent de très bonnes relations.

La représentante Khady, est âgée de 24 ans, elle est mariée mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine dans son village mais fait parallèlement de la vente de "thiakry" (couscous au lait).Elle est debout à droite habillée en wax et a levé la main gauche.

Pour ce prêt elle compte acheter 2 bœufs pour l'embouche et le reste les produits nécessaires pour le thiakry ( mil, sucre etc....)


Elle souhaite réinjecter ses bénéfices pour renforcer ses activités et maximiser ses gains; mais aussi aider son mari à assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group consists of 20 women who live in the same village and get along very well with one another.

The group's representative, Khady, is 24 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She is involved in fattening cattle in her village and she also sells "thiakry" (a type of couscous prepared with milk).  In the photo, she is standing on the right-hand side, wearing a dress made of wax-print fabric, and she is raising her left hand.

She plans to use her loan to buy two oxen to be fattened and, with the rest of the money, the supplies necessary to prepare thiakry (millet, sugar etc.).

She would like to reinvest her profits in her business in order to boost her activities and maximize her earnings.  She would also like to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy oxen for cattle fattening.

loans.name: Bakhat

texts.en: Bakhat, age 48, is a married woman involved in the business of milk sales with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Bakhat’s husband. They started this business thirty years ago with a little source of income. By this time they have become famous for providing good quality milk and make enough to lead a decent life. Due to an increase in the demand for milk, they need to purchase another buffalo. For this reason, Bakhat applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Qamr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Qamr and consists of three ladies living in Aden. They are hardworking women who aim to improve their businesses. They applied for a second loan of 150,000 YER. 

Sawod is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She has been selling clothes for ladies for many years. She is the breadwinner who tries to provide for her family. She would like to expand her business, so she applied for a second loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy ladies’ clothes to increase her profit. 

All members of this group are grateful to Kiva lenders who funded them in the first loan.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes to increase her profit.

loans.name: Mujahida

texts.en:
Ms. Mujahida, age 47, has been dealing in the business of clothes trade for the past fifteen years. She offers a variety of ladies’ clothes to the people of her community. She started her business very small, but by this time she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

Currently, she contacted Kashf Foundation to purchase a stock of ladies’ clothes for the summer season to inflate her sales. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. She is hopeful to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing good quality food, health and education to her three children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of ladies’ clothes for the summer season to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Delmar

texts.es:
Delmar es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Delmar no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Delmar trabaja como chofer de mototaxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Delmar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general que necesita su mototaxi, de esta manera Delmar tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y podrá atender a mas pasajeros, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Delmar is a single, 21 year old man. He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with  a great wish to succeed.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and due to the need to work to help his parents, Delmar has not been able to study to become a mechanical engineer as he wished. In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes he cooks a delicious rice and chicken dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with a great deal of dedication and effort, Delmar works as a motorcycle taxi driver providing transportation services in the city. He works everyday for approximately 12 hours and believes that he is doing well because he knows the areas where he can find the greatest number of passengers.

Delmar is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to have needed repairs and general maintenance done on his motorcycle taxi. In this way, Delmar’s work machine will be in the best condition and he will be able to serve more passengers. Moreover, he will continue working and striving to fulfill his great dream of being able to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Kipkorir

texts.en:
Kipkorir is a married man, aged 46, and is blessed with four children aged between 20 and 14 years old.  He is a mixed farmer in Koibatek and has been in operation for a period of over 12 years, earning an income of KES 30,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000 as his fourth loan and intends to use this amount to pay school fees for his children, who are in various schools. The profits he earns from the sale of his farm produce will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to succeed in his farming activities.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and has two children. He is 48 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS, Philippines. Daniel is a farmer and grows squash to earn a living. He has been doing this for nine years. He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. Daniel has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future Daniel hopes to own a factory.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Narcis

texts.en:
Narcis is a 49-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been working as a car mechanic since 20 years ago, and it is his only source for living. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort into providing his family with the best living and education.

Narcis is well known in his region and highly recommended by customers for his special experience in his domain and his good reputation.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary spare parts requested for his business needs and development. 

Narcis is planning to keep on increasing his customers and business capital to keep his customers and family satisfied. His business is located in an area with many businesses, where everyone visits because of the special services and products provided.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 24, is single and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He has been operating a fabrication and engineering business for the last three years.

He heard about Milango from friends. He seeks a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy new equipment to help him run his business more smoothly. In five years, he wants to raise his business into a full workshop.

The high cost of materials is the challenge Stephen is facing right now. He hopes to build his own house out of the income that he gets.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his fabrication and engineering business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: At the age of 47, Ms Safia is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She started her business of thread making 5 months ago as she felt that her husband’s income is not enough for her household expenditures. She has one thread making machine; she works over it, and after manufacturing good quality thread she reels it and sells it to the people of her community. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. After seeing the demand from her customers she needs to purchase another thread making machine. For this she applied a loan of Rs. 20,000 to Kashf Foundation. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits for the betterment of her family members. She also aspires to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase another thread making machine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married with a five-month-old baby.

He has been operating a food café for the last four years. He has three employees. He heard about Milango through friends and he is seeking a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to purchase utensils used to serve customers. He is employed and that’s where he gets extra income.

He sees his food café growing into a restaurant in five years time. He plans to save and educate his child from the income that he gets. The major challenge he faces is workers not being faithful.

loans.use: to purchase utensils used to serve customers

loans.name: Ana Concepción

texts.es:
Ana Concepción es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un pueblo rodeado de montañas florecidas y ríos caudalosos que hacen del paisaje un atractivo turístico.

Se graduó como profesora de primaria y actualmente ejerce su profesión con esmero y dedicación donde tiene más de veinte años de experiencia.

Tuvo cuatro hijos tres de ellos a su cargo los cuales estudian en la universidad y a pesar de ganar tan poco ella y su esposo hacen gran esfuerzo y se limitan de muchas cosas para lograr su objetivo de ver a sus hijos preparados profesionalmente.

Con el fin de mejorar la cocina de su vivienda, ya que entró la temporada de invierno y el agua inunda dicha cocina está solicitando por primera vez un crédito en Ceprodel ya que escuchó que hay unos inversionistas llamados Kiva que apoyan al más necesitado y de escasos recursos y tal es su caso porque solamente cuentan con su salario.

Con este crédito pretende comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para poder cumplir su plan de inversión.
texts.en:
Ana Concepción is from the town of El Sauce, a town surrounded by the flowery mountains and fast flowing rivers that make the landscape a tourist attraction.  

She graduated with a teaching degree and now she practices her profession with diligence and dedication. She has more than twenty years experience.

She had four children. Three of them are under her responsibility. They go to college and despite earning so little, she and her husband make a big effort and limit themselves in many things so they can reach their goal of seeing their children be well prepared for their careers.

In order to improve the kitchen in her home, since it is winter and water is flooding it, she is asking for a loan for the first time from Ceprodel. She heard of some investors called Kiva who support the people who are most in need and who are of low income. That is her case because they only have her salary. 

With this loan, she intends on buying bricks, cement, sand, zinc sheeting and to pay for labor costs.

She hopes and trusts in God that her application will be approved so that she can carry out her investment plan.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, zinc sheeting, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Leoncio Daniel

texts.es:
Leoncio es un hombre de 33 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Leoncio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
 Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Leoncio trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Leoncio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento general de su taxi, de esta manera Leoncio tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Leoncio is a 33 year old man, who is single and lives in the city of Ica.  He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who puts all his efforts into getting ahead.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and the necessity of having to work since he was very young, Leoncio couldn't study a professional career, although he would have liked to.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and on some occasions, he makes the delicious ceviche to share with his family.

By his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Leoncio works as a taxi driver, offering transportation services in his city.  He works everyday for approximately 12 hours and believes it to be going well because he knows the areas where he can find the greatest quantity of passengers.  Leoncio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered, he will be able to provide replacement parts and general maintenance of his taxi.  In this way, Leoncio will have his work "tool" in better condition, and thus, he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to provide replacement parts and general maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Mohamad Samir

texts.en:
Mohamad Samir is a 53-year-old married man, the father of two children and a Syrian citizen. His main aim in life is to be able to provide for his family as long as he is capable of working.

Mohamad has worked as a tailor for 28 years. He is a hard worker with special talents in this area and has a good reputation in his community. He works from his house where he is putting much effort into his business so as to develop it and provide his family with the best living ever.

Mohamad is applying for a 600 USD loan through Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to pay his child's university fees.

loans.use: To pay his child's university fees.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena, es Madre de dos hijos, y posee un negocio de ropa usada  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace 17 años, inicia sus labores desde las 7:00 am  y finaliza a las 4 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a viernes  ella realiza este tipo de trabajo para llevar  el sustento a su familia ya que es madre soltera. 

Doña María Elena  está solicitando este crédito a Ceprodel  para  comprar paca de ropa de mejor calidad y así aprovechar las ventas ya que se aproxima el día de las madres nicaragüense,  lo que le  permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Ella sueña con la preparación profesional de sus dos único hijos.
texts.en:
Señora María Elena is the mother of two children.  She has had a used clothing business in of one León's markets for the last seventeen years.  She starts work at 7:00am and finishes and 4:00pm Monday through Friday.  She works to support her family, as she is a single mother. 

Doña María Elena is requesting this loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase bundles of higher quality clothing so she can increase her sales with the approach of the Nicaraguan Mother's Day.  This will allow her and her family a better quality of life.   Doña María Elena hopes to prepare her two children to be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Johana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Johana vive en la cuidad de Managua casada, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación  atendiendo a su clientela desde las 6 am hasta las 8 pm desde hace tres años y esto le ha ayudado a mantener el sustento y estudios de sus hijos que están en edad escolar.

Está solicitando  a kiva un financiamiento para invertirlo  en la compra de productos como  arroz, azúcar ,jabón aceite  y otros productos para comercializarlo en su negocio para incrementar su ventas y así aumentar sus ganancia ya que esto le permite mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Señora Johana lives in the city of Managua.  She is married and has run a small grocery out of her home for the last three years.  Her store is open from 6:00am until 8:00pm.  Her grocery store has helped to provide an education to her children, who are school-aged. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva to invest in the purchase of products like rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil and other items.  She will sell the products in her store, which will increase her sales and her income.  This will allow her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soap, rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam is 31 years old and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been in rice farming on four hectares of farmland for ten years, earning about 14,000 KHR per day. 

Nam’s group consists of two members and she has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while her co-member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Nam has used the past loans successfully to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Adolfo Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Adolfo vive en la cuida de Managua trabaja en como conductor en  una empresa del estado.

Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales  construcción  de una pared de su vivienda.

Don Adolfo agradece a la fuentes de financiamiento  ya que los crédito obtenido anteriormente le ha servido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida para él y su familia
texts.en:
Señor Adolfo lives in the city of Managua.  He works as a driver for a state company. 

Don Adolfo is known for being a responsible person.  He is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction materials for work on a wall in his home. 

Don Adolfo is grateful for the financing resource, as the loans he has previously received have served to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married with three children. She is 49 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS.

Arlyn is a farmer and grows squash to earn a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer.

Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future she hopes that she will have her own factory.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single lady, aged 29 years old. She learned about KADET LTD from a group in her area which is funded by KADET LTD. 

Sarah operates a boutique shop in Narok town and has been running this business for one year, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.  She has borrowed her first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use for purchasing more clothing for her business.   The anticipated profit will be used to expand her clothing and jewelery business.  Her dreams is to improve her living standards and buy her own residential plot.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 29 years old. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya.  She has been operating a food canteen for four years now, mainly selling cooked food to her customers. She knew Milango through a friend who invited her and she joined.  

Saumu is seeking a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings, which she intends to use to buy stock for her business. This business is the only source of income she has. The major challenge she is facing is clients eating on credit and don't pay in time.

loans.use: buy flour and beans

loans.name: Darling De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Darling habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su familia, su mayor sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el es agricultor desde hace mucho tiempor, actualmente tiene una man zana de yuca y requiere de capita para darle mantenimiento, con este credito comprara los siguientes insumos: triple, Urea, Completo 30-15-30, asi cu cosecha sera de buena calidad y al momento de venderla le generara mejores ingresos tambien tiene pensado establecer media manzana mas de yuca por los que comprara madera para sembrarla, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado estos años.
texts.en: Darling lives in the city of Masaya, along with his family.  His greatest dream is to improve his living conditions.  He has been a farmer for a long time and currently has a hectare of yucca and needs money to maintain it.  He will use the money from this loan to buy the following supplies: triple urea and 30-15-30 fertilizer.  In this way his harvest will be of good quality and he will have better earnings when he sells it.  He also plans to set up another half hectare of yucca and he will buy lumber for it.  He is grateful for the Afodenic support and the Kiva funds he has gotten over the years.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es:
Dalia Sonia es originaria de la comarca San José ubicada a 5 km del municipio de El Sauce, es un caserío calmo alejado del bullicio de la ciudad. 

A la orilla de la carretera está ubicada la escuela donde Dalia Sonia imparte clases de primaria a todos los niños de esa localidad donde tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse a este oficio que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y educar a su único hijo.

Es una señora muy querida por los pobladores, sus alumnos y su familia por el carisma y el apoyo que le brinda al necesitado bajo sus posibilidades.

En este momento está solicitando un crédito para pagar la operación de un sobrino que se fracturó la rodilla y que urge le practiquen esta operación para que mejore su salud.
texts.en:
Dalia Sonia is a native of the San José region, which is located 5 km from the municipality of El Sauce.  She lives in a calm, rural area removed from the bustle of the city.  

At the edge of the highway is the school where Dalia Sonia teaches classes to all the primary school students in the area.  She has been teaching there for more than twenty years.  Her work as a teacher has allowed her to support her household and educate her only son. 

Because of her charisma and the support she has given to those in need, Dalia Sonia is well loved by the people in her area, her students and her family.  

At this time, she is requesting a loan to pay for a nephew's surgery.  He fractured his knee and urgently needs an operation to improve his health.

loans.use: to pay for a nephew's surgery.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and live in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known.  She is married and has children ages between 16 and 3 years old who are presently in school and live at home.  She a high school graduate.  

For the past three years, Margaret has been running a shop where she sells dresses and lappas (traditional clothing).  She started this business by dressing hair.  With the little money that she received from this hair dressing business she managed to establish her current business and learned this ways of selling from her friends.  She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profits and it keeps her busy.  Most interestingly, she has learned difference kinds of local languages. 

Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more dresses and lappas to increase her sales. Her plans are to build another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 27 years old. She lives in Batumi District with her husband, two children and father-in-law. Madona requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Madona has been renting out a commercial space, which is the only source of income for her family. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Madona requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit, Madona will open a used clothing shop. She has space on the first floor of her house, where she will open a shop for used clothing. This will increase the income of their household. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to open a used clothing shop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 29-year-old married lady and a mother of three children aged between thirteen and two years old. She is a farmer who learned about KADET LTD from fellow farmers in her area. 

Gladys has been farming maize and wheat on her own piece of land for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.  She has acquired her fourth loan of KES 20,000,  which will enable her to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. The proceeds will be used to meet her family's basic needs. 

Gladys hopes to uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Please meet 28-year-old Bendu from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Bendu completed 8th grade and is married. Her husband is a barber. She has two children between the ages of 8 and 5. Her two children are in school and they both live at home. 

Bendu has owned her own business selling peppers, oil, okra, and other items for the past four years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase goods.  
On average, she works 7 hours at her business each day. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit. In the future, she would like to build a shop.  
She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase goods.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
La profesora Adriana Mercedes es una maestra con más de veinte años de experiencia, casada, madre de tres hijos en edad escolar. 

Habita en el municipio de El Sauce y se siente muy contenta y orgullosa de ser originaria de este pueblo lleno de bondades y de gente muy generosa.

Gracias a todos los créditos que le ha financiado Ceprodel con fondos de los inversionistas Kiva ha mejorado enormemente su vivienda, hoy tienen mejores condiciones de vida ella y su familia y por lo tanto un mejor nivel de vida.

Actualmente quiere construir un sumidero para instalar un inodoro, ya que en este poblado no existen aguas negras con el fin de no usar más el servicio higiénico que no presta las condiciones adecuadas atenta contra la salud de su familia y a contaminar el medio ambiente.

Con este crédito pretende comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena.
Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva aprobarán su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Adriana Mercedes is a teacher with more than twenty years of experience.  She is married and the mother of three school-aged children.

Adriana Mercedes lives in the municipality of El Sauce.  She feels very happy about and proud of being a native of this town, which is full of kindness and generous people. 

Thanks to all of the loans that Ceprodel has financed with Kiva lender funds, Adriana Mercedes has enormously improved her housing.  Today she and her family have better living conditions, and therefore a better quality of life. 

She currently wants to build a sewer drain to install a toilet.  In her town, there is no sewer.  She wants to stop using the family restroom, which doesn't offer adequate conditions to keep her family healthy and does contaminates the environment. 

With this loan, Adriana Mercedes plans to purchase bricks, cement and sand. 
She trusts in G-d that the Kiva investors will approve her request so she will be able to make her investment.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Aurelio Adolfo

texts.es:
Don Aurelio Adolfo es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un señor casado de 58 años con un pequeño hijo a su cargo.

Desde hace 11 años se dedica a laborar como Guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada, labor que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Su familia es muy unida y su esposa para ayudarle a cubrir los gastos del hogar se dedica a elaborar tortillas el cual es un trabajo digno y admirable.

Don Aurelio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones del negocio de su esposa está solicitando un crédito para construir un fogón en el cual elaborará las tortillas con el que piensa comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra.

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel apoyarán su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión donde quedará eternamente agradecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Aurelio Adolfo is originally from the town of El Sauce.  He is 58 years old.  He is married with a small child in his care.
For 11 years he has worked as a security guard for a private company.  This work permits him to bring home bread every day.
His family is very close.  His wife makes tortillas to help him cover the living expenses.  This is dignified and admirable work.

With the intention of improving his wife’s business conditions, Aurelio is asking for a loan to build an outdoor oven in which his wife will make tortillas.  With the loan, he will buy brick, cement, sand, and pay for manual labor. 

He trusts in God that the Kiva and Ceprodel lenders will approve his application to carry out it’s investment.  He will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Misael es un hombre de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pareja y sus dos pequeñas hijas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Misael no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, en su ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Misael trabaja brindando servicios de instalación de sistemas de riesgo para diversas empresas agropecuarias, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
 Misael se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar palos de eucalipto, caña chancada y esteras, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar el techado de su vivienda, ya que actualmente su casa es de esteras y está deteriorada por el sol y el viento, de esta manera Misael y su familia podrán tener mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijas convertidas en buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Misael is a 25-year-old man. He lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with his wife and their two small daughters, whom he loves and who are his main motivation in life. 

He is a very cheerful, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, who has a strong desire to overcome. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the fact that he needed to work to help out his parents since he was very young, Misael was not able to study for the professional career in Engineering that he hoped for. 

In his free time, he likes to play sports, and sometimes, he cooks a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (dried potatoes with meat, sauce, and a side of soup) to share with his family. 

Through his own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Misael works offering irrigation installation systems to various farming businesses. He works every day for approximately 10 hours, and he believes that it’s going well for him because of his excellent performance and the kind treatment that he shows to others. 

Misael is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to carry out improvements on his home. He wants to buy eucalyptus trees and sugar cane stalks and mats, which he will use to make improvements on his house’s roof. 

Currently, his house is made of matting, and it’s damaged from the sun and wind. In this way, Misael and his family will be able to have greater security and well-being, so he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his greatest dream of seeing his daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to make improvements on his home.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 59 years old. He lives in the Lentekhi District with his spouse and son. Elguja has requested loans from the local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time, because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is agricultural activities. In particular, they have two pigs and eight beehives with bee colonies. They sell honey locally at a good price. Besides this, he works as an artisan and gets a small income. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the poor subsistence category. 

Elguja requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Elguja has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Elguja will renovate a space and purchase a stock of groceries. After the renovation is finished and the groceries are purchased, he will be able to open a shop. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate a space and purchase a stock of groceries.

loans.name: Makoyah

texts.en:
Makoyah is a business woman from Liberia. She is single and has three children between the ages of 28 and nine. Two of her children are currently attending school and live at home. She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as a working woman.
She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, passed the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and one will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 
Makoyah has a table business for the past three years from which she sells palm oil, rice, etc. She works ten hours per day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day own a house. Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her food stall.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has a clothes-selling business in Thika Road area of Nairobi. She is 32-years-old, married, and has two children. She has been in this business for two years.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of clothes to sell. This includes shirts, socks, and sweaters for children. She will use the generated income to start a farming business.

She hopes to grow her business, open a boutique, and sell more varieties of clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus runs a hotel business in Tala town. He is 30 years old and has been in this business for nine years. He is married and has two children.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of sugar, milk, flour, and rice for use in his business. This will enable him to meet the high demands of his customers as well as generate more income that he will use to pay the school fees for his children. 

He hopes to open a restaurant and be successful in his business thereby building a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, sugar, and milk for his hotel business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 40 years old and married with two children. She has a tailoring business in Kangundo and has been in this business for the past 10 years. It has been profitable.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD; she plans to use the amount to buy fabric materials, threads, and buttons for use in her tailoring business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy fabric materials, thread, and buttons for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a business woman from Liberia. She is single and has three children, between the ages of seven and four years. Her children are currently attending school and live at home. She has completed grade 12 before starting her business. She describes herself as a working woman.
She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, passed the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and one will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 
Patricia has a table business from which she sells palm oil, rice, etc for the past ten years. She works ten hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day own a house. Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her food stall business.

loans.name: Marpu

texts.en:
Marpu is a business woman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children, between the ages of 20 and 16 years. Two of her children are currently attending school and live at home. She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as a working woman.
She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, passed the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and one will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 
Marpu has a table business from which she sells palm oil, rice, etc for the past 10 years. She works ten hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house. Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her food stall business.

loans.name: Benea

texts.en:
Benea is 26 years old and married with one child. He does a motorcycle transport business in Nairobi and has been in this business for two years now.

This will be his second loan from KADET LTD; he wants to contribute towards buying a group vehicle for his public transport business. He will use the generated profits to buy land.

He hopes to invest more in the transport business and own his own vehicle, make more income, and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To contribute towards buying a group vehicle for his transport business.

loans.name: Modhla Group

texts.en: Modhla is a three-member group. All of them are poor ladies from Aden, Yemen. They applied for a 170,000 YER loan from AMB to renovate their houses. Saba is a 49-year-old married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Aden. Her house is very old and in a miserable situation. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of house renovation, she will start accumulating money to improve the life conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to use for renovating their houses.

loans.name: Musau

texts.en:
Musau is a fruits farmer in Makueni where he mostly grows mangoes. He sells the mangoes at the market place and also supplies them to fruit companies. He is 43 years old, a widower, and has five children. He has been in this business for the past 13 years and it has been profitable.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD; he plans to use the amount to buy pesticides and fungicides for controlling pests. This will enable him get more harvest from which he will generate more income. He will use the income to provide for the needs of his family.

He hopes to grow more varieties of fruits and sell them to other towns in the region making more income and opening a business for his children.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for use in the farm.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel, 39 years old, is married with three children; two of whom attend school. He has been buying and supplying building blocks for the last five years. He lives in Likoni south of Mombasa, Kenya. He has employed workers who help him run the business. Joel, just as many other people, knew Milango from friends who invited him. He seeks a loan of 15,850 Kenyan shillings to buy working tools. This is the only business that gives him income. The major challenge that he faces in his business is the unavailability of transport. He wishes to work hard and get his own truck to help him ferry the blocks to the customer’s place of work. He wishes to improve his standard of living through this business.

loans.use: to buy tools for his bricks supplying business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a dairy farmer. She sells and supplies milk to various dairy shops. She is 40 years old and married. 

This is her second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to buy more stock of dairy feed and meal for her dairy cow. She will use the generated income to pay the school fees for her children. 

She hopes to buy more dairy cows and become a successful dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed for her farming business.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is a business woman from Liberia. She is single and has three children, between the ages of 12 and six years. Her three children are currently attending school and living at home. She has completed grade 12 before starting her business. She describes herself as a working woman. She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, passed Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and one will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Watta has a table business from which she sells palm oil, rice, etc for the past seven years. She works ten hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day own a house. Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her food stall business.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah does a dairy farming business in Thika road area of Nairobi. She is 41 years old and married with four children. She has been in the dairy farming business for the last four years.
