This is her second loan, and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of animal feed for her dairy cows. She anticipates making more income that she will use to buy another dairy cow.

She hopes to own a ranch for dairy cattle and thereby supply milk to milk processing industries.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson sells cereals in Makueni. These include maize and beans as well as rice. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

This being his first loan term, he plans to buy more stock of cereals to sell. These include maize and beans. He will use the generated income to pay the school fees for his children. 

He hopes to be successful in his cereals-selling business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 26-year-old, industrious gentleman. He is married to Esther and is a father of two children aged eight and five.

Jeremiah has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He learned about KADET LTD from other riders who are registered members. He has acquired his first loan of KES 75,000, which will facilitate acquiring his own motorcycle. The proceeds will be used to cater to the family's basic needs. His dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: This is 32 year old Theresa from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, passed Freeport. It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for their fresh fish as it is located by the ocean. However, it is also one of the poorer areas and housing quality is often very low. She is a single mother with three children.  One child aged is 11 years. Her spouse works as a teacher.  Two children live at home and go to school. Theresa has a table business from which she sells bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc. She has been in business for five years and works nine hours per day. With this loan, she will buy inventory. One of the greatest challenges she faces is less income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her savings club (susu). She is proud of her business because she makes more profit. Her plan is to build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: she will buy inventory for her food stall business.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla has a retail shop in Tala town where she sells both household and retail items. She is 62 years old, married and has been in this business for the past 15 years.

This being her third loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, rice and flour. She will use the generated income to build a house.

She hopes to be successful in her business and be able to provide the needs of her grandchildren such as school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, flour and other items to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 29 years old, married and has two children. He has a retail shop business in Kangundo town and has been in this business for four years.

This being his third loan from KADET LTD, he plans to buy more stock of soft drinks, cakes, biscuits, sugar, rice and milk to sell. He will use the generated income to educate his children by paying their school fees. 

He hopes to grow his business by opening a wholesale shop, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, cakes, biscuits, sugar, rice and milk to sell

loans.name: Koileken

texts.en:
Koileken is 41 years old and supports a family of six members. He is married to Grace, who operates a small food cafe and brings in additional income.

Koileken is a farmer as well as a shopkeeper. He learned about KADET LTD from a friend who is already registered. He has acquired his fourth loan of KES 10,000 to buy more stock of soaps, washing detergents, and cooking fat for sale.

He hopes to revive his business and take care of his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, washing detergents, and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Jose Arly

texts.es: Don José, es un  señor de  48 años, habita en el barrio Georgino Andrade de Managua, es casado  tiene solamente un hijo quien va a la universidad, don José se dedica a la elaboración de espejos enmarcados y cuadros decorativos, los que vende de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación, el busca como crecer y salir adelante con su obra. El crédito lo solicita para comprar materia prima para continuar su labor diaria, comprara varilla de resina, marcos de madera para espejos, entre otros, con estos ingresos podrá cumplir con los diferentes pagos básicos del hogar.
texts.en: José is 48 years old and lives in the Georgino Andrade barrio of Managua.  He is married and has only one son, who is attending university.  José earns a living making framed mirrors and decorative frames.  He sells them in the streets and out of his home and is looking to grow and move forward with his business.  José is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies to continue with his daily work.  He will buy resin and wood for mirrors, and other items.  With the income he will earn, José will be able to buy his various household bills.

loans.use: to buy resin and wood for mirrors and frames.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is 40 years of age and lives in Likoni South of Mombasa, Kenya. She has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years and she has one employee. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school. Apart from the motorcycle business, she also sells clothes for additional income. 

She heard of Milango from friends who invited her to join. She now seeks a loan of 74,450 KES (Kenyan shillings) that will help her repair her motorcycle. She hopes to own a fleet of motorcycles and employ more people in the future. The major challenge to her business is the weather since during the rains most customers will prefer other means of transport.
 
With the profits from this loan, she wants to educate her children and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es: Lizeth, una joven madre soltera que no ha tenido suerte en la vida con su pareja y ella sola está luchando buscando como salir adelante junto a sus pequeños hijos quienes son unos adolecentes aun, ella continua trabajando como empacadora en una empresa de plásticos y para lograr equilibrar sus gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos vende zapatos, cosméticos, ropa por encargo, es por eso que solicita el crédito para invertirlo con los productos mencionados anteriormente, agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de financiamiento ya que sin ello no podría continuar con su venta.
texts.en: Lizeth is a young, single mother who has not had much luck in life with her partner.  She is alone and fighting to find a way to move forward in life with her teenage sons.  She continues to work as a packer at a plastics company.  In addition, in order to pay household costs and her children's education, she sells shoes, make-up, and clothes (to order).  She is applying for a loan to invest in these products.  Lizeth is grateful for the financial support as, without it, she would not be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics and men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Irma Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Irma de 62 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella vive en casa propia y su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos dedicandose desde hace varios años.
Doña Irma sus clientes son los amigos y personas que le alquilan sus habitaciones es una mujer muy trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Irma está solicitando el préstamo para compra de puertas, ventanas, celosías, cemento, grava, arena, etc. para mejorar sus habitaciones y poder brindarles a sus clientes mayor comodidad en sus habitaciones.
Doña Irma con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y por ende obtener mejores ganancias que ayuden a salir adelante, su sueño es tener su propia casa propia.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Irma is 62 years old and single.  She does not have any children who depend on her.  Irma lives in her own house and for several years has had a business renting out rooms.

Irma's customers are friends and other people.  She is very hard-working and has a strong will to prosper.

Irma is applying for this loan to buy doors, windows, trellises, cement, gravel, stone, and more, in order to improve her rooms and to be able to provide her customers with a more comfortable space.

With this support, Irma hopes to improve her business and, as a result, to increase her earnings, which will help her to prosper.  Her dream is to have her own home.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras.  May 2013.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, trellises, cement, gravel, stone, and more for her business.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Rosas Rojas está formado por 9 mujeres que trabajan a diario en diferentes actividades pero con un mismo fin el cual es la superación personal y familiar, su orgullo es mantener la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres. Viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute, este lugar tiene un clima privilegiado, sus tierras son fértiles donde se cosechan las más ricas frutas y bellas flores, su geografía nos regala los más hermosos paisajes.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, es una socia fundadora del banco comunal Rosas Rojas y es la presidenta de este grupo. 

La Señora. Blanca tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 17 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia y trabaja para sus gastos personales, su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Blanca es una mujer muy dedicada a su hogar pero también aporta económicamente a su casa, se dedica a las tareas del campo como es la agricultura en donde siembra verduras y hortalizas, sus productos los vende en su casa o en el mercado del cantón. También cría becerros, cerdos, cuyes y gallinas, hace 6 meses puso una tienda en la que trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo. 

El dinero de su crédito es para comprar víveres para su tienda.

Su meta es agrandar mucho más su tienda.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Rosas Rojas" communal bank has nine members who have different businesses but the same goals: to overcome personal and family problems.  They are proud to continue their parents' traditions and cultures.  The group's members live around the Paute canton, which has an exceptional climate.  The land is fertile and here the locals harvest the most delicious fruits and beautiful flowers.  The region's geography gives us some of the most beautiful countryside.

One member of this group is Blanca.  A founding members of "Rosas Rojas", she is now president of the group.

Blanca is 39 years old, married and living with her partner, with whom she has three children - aged 22, 17, and six years old.  The oldest is married and independent while her second child is studying and working to cover his personal costs.  Blanca's daughter, the youngest, is in one of the local schools.

Blanca is dedicated to her home but she also supports the household financially, making a living doing work in fields growing vegetables. She sells her products out of her home and at the market.  Blanca also raises young bulls, pigs, guinea pigs and hens.  Six months ago she started a shop and works there every day with no fixed timetable.

This loan will be used to buy supplies for her shop.

Blanca's goal is to expand the business.

The small photo is of a member who could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface lives in Butere, in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 		

Boniface is married, and has three children. His wife runs a small business, while he farms their land. He has been farming for 10 years, and is currently growing maize and beans. He likes working with Honey Care because they give free service on their beehives. He is also looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because he will have his own supply of honey, which he uses as a medicine if he or his family becomes sick. 

This is Boniface’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help him start a small business of his own.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta, tiene la edad de 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 una zona en donde los pobladores son de escasos recursos, ella es casada su esposo labora como maestro de obras, los dos han trabajado bastante para sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad e independientes, Vicenta busca como progresar se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado y el crédito que solicita es para invertir en este pequeño negocio, lo que le permitirá  mantener sus ingresos para poder suplir sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Vicenta is 44 years old and lives in the 380 barrio, where the population is very poor.  Vicenta is married; her husband works as a tradesman.  Both of them work a lot to help their children - now independent adults - to move forward in life.  Vicenta is looking to progress with her business.  She makes a living selling clothes and footwear and this loan will be used to invest in this little business.  The loan will allow her to maintain her income to buy the bare necessities.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan is 31 years old. She has two children who are learning in primary school. Her husband and she work as carpenters to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for four years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to expand her business and raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Ihromiddin

texts.ru: Ихромиддину 33 года. Он женат и у него трое детей. Ихромиддин со своей семьей проживает в Хатлонской области в районе Джиликуль. Он имеет только среднее образование. Он спокойный и добрый человек. Жена Ихромиддина занимается хозяйственными делами по дому. Сам Ихромиддин в течение 7 лет работает в сельском хозяйстве. Джиликуль является родиной картофеля в Таджикистане. Жители района Джиликула в основном зарабатывают на жизнь путем посева и продажи картофеля, в их числе и Ихромиддин. Он занимается посевами картофеля и лука. Ихромиддин запрашивает кредит для закупа минерального удобрения с целью обработки земли. Он хочет собрать богатый урожай картофеля и лука и полученную прибыль использовать на расширение земледельческой деятельности.
texts.en: Ihromiddin is 33 years old. He is married and has three children. Ihmoriddin and his family live in the Khalton province in the region of Jilikul. He only has secondary education. He is a calm and kind man. Ihromiddin's wife takes care of the household. Ihromiddin has been working in the farming business for seven years. Jilikul is a hometown of potato in Tajikistan. The residents of the Jilikul region mainly make a living by sowing and selling potato, and so does Ihromiddin. He sows potato and onion. Ihromiddin is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer with the purpose of cultivating the land. He wants to collect a rich harvest of potato and onion and use the profit to expand the agriculture business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for the potato and onion harvest.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a 34-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is single and has four children between 17 and 10 years old. They are currently attending school and living at home.  She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as a working woman. She lives and works in the St. Paul area.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Kumba has had a table business selling palm oil, sugar etc for the past seven years.  She works 10 hours at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is her small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use:
to buy more
 palm oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Juan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver partidos de futbol.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, adicionalmente también brinda servicios como albañil, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como ladrillos, cemento, arena y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder construir la cocina de su vivienda y también podrá comprar un poco de más de abarrotes y bebidas para abastecer su negocio, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda brindando mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, lives in the city of Pisco, together with his wife and their young son. He loves him and he is his main motivation in life. Juan is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person. Together with his wife, he works hard to get ahead with his family. Unfortunately, due to the lack of money and the difficult situation, he has had to work since he was very young. He could not study Civil Engineering, although he would have wanted to. During his free time he likes to watch football.

Juan took the initiative to open a grocery store, where he works hard. He also works as a mason and works in total around twelve hours every day. He believes that he is successful because he offers good prices and is kind to his customers.

Juan appreciates the help that Kiva lenders gave him, since he will be able to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, and sand. With these materials he will build a kitchen in his house and with the remaining money he will buy some food supplies and beverages for his store. He will continue to work hard in order to finish building his house and provide his family with a more comfortable and safer environment, which is his biggest dream.

loans.use: to build a kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Yakub

texts.ru: Якубу 50 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Якуб более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он работает с удовольствием, так как он с детства мечтал стать шофёром. Якуб перевозит пассажиров с одного района в другой район. Он должен всегда стараться предоставлять услуги таксиста на высшем уровне, так как конкуренция большая. Его машина в последнее время имеет плохое состояние, и он из-за этого теряет клиентов. Он должен срочно отремонтировать свою машину, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для ремонта автомашины. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Yakub is 50 years old and he is married with six children at home.  He has been a taxi driver for more than five years, a job he does with pleasure because it was his childhood dream to become a chauffeur.  Yakub takes passengers from one region to another.  He should always try to give the highest level of service, as the competition is high in his field.  He has been losing clients lately because his car is in poor shape.  Yakub urgently needs to repair his car, but he doesn't have the money.  He is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to make repairs to his car.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Deycy Mayra

texts.es:
Deycy es una mujer de 27 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camana con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Deycy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Deycy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza y joyas de fantasía, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Deycy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear y pintar la fachada de su hogar, de esta manera Deycy y su familia tendrán un ambiente adecuado y seguro, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Deycy is 27 years old and lives in the city of Camana with her parents and siblings.  She is very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic, and has a great desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, and because she had to work from a young age, Deycy was not able to study business at university as she had wanted. In her spare time Deycy likes to watch films and, on occasion, prepare a delicious "chupe de camarones" (prawn soup) to share with her family.

With her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Deycy has a small business selling beauty products and costume jewellery.  She works every day for around ten hours each day.  She thinks the business is going well because of the good prices and because of the friendly treatment to gives to others.

Deycy is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to this loan, she will be able to make improvements to her home.  She needs to put primer on and paint the front of her home.  With this Deycy and her family will have a suitable and safe home and Deycy will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve her great dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia es una mujer de 51 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camana, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Ignacia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ignacia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de refresco, ella se levanta todos los días temprano para preparar refrescos naturales como chicha, maracuyá y otros, Ignacia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ignacia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña carreta, la cual le servirá de mucho para vender sus refrescos y emolientes para la época de inviernos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 51 years old and lives in the city of Camana.  She is friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic, and puts all her efforts into moving forward in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because she had to work from a young age to help her parents, Ignacia was not able to study at university.  In her spare time, Ignacia likes to walk around the welcoming streets of the city and, on occasion, she prepares a mouth-watering "chupe de camarones" (prawn soup) to share with her family.

With her own initiative, and with a lot of determination and dedication, Ignacia has a small business selling soft drinks.  She wakes up very early every day in order to prepare natural juices made with maize, passionfruit and more.  Ignacia works every day for around ten hours and she thinks the work is going well because of the accessible prices and the friendly service she offers.

Ignacia is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy a small cart.  The cart will be of great use as she sells her drinks and "emolientes" (a soothing, hot beverage) in the winter.  With it, Ignacia will continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her big dream of having a market stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмону 31 год. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Он более 3 лет занимается предоставлением услуги сварщика, а также производством разных вещей из железа. Этот бизнес является основным источником семейного дохода. Он дополнительно занимается перевозки товаров со своим мотоциклом. Абдурахмон хочет развевать бизнес, так как требование детей год за годом увеличивается. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки железы, угольника и других материалов для того, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is 31 years old and he is married with four children at home.  His wife is a homemaker and she takes care of the children, all of whom are still minors.  For more than three years, Abdurahmon has been working as a welder and he makes various items out of iron.  This business is his family's main source of income.  To supplement this income, Abdurahmon also transports goods on his motorcycle.  He wants to increase his business, as his children's needs increase with each passing year.  He is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy iron, a set square and other materials to increase his working capital.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy iron and a set square to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: Фарангису 19 лет. Она умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Фарангис не замужем и живет с родителями. После того, как она успешно окончила среднюю школу, она поступила в Таджикский Педагогический Университет. Данное время она является успешной студенткой 2 курса. Фарангис много читает классическую литературу. Она мечтает после окончания университета стать профессиональным педагогом. Она с детства мечтает внести свой вклад в систему образования таджикского народа и желает, чтобы молодежь Таджикистана была образованной. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farangis is 19 years old.  She is a smart and hard-working young woman who is single and lives with her parents.  After she successfully finished high school, she enrolled in the Tajik Pedagogical University, where she is currently doing well as a sophomore.  Farangis reads a lot of classical literature.  She dreams of becoming a professional teacher after graduation.  Since her childhood, she has dreamed of contributing to the Tajik national education system and she wants the young people of Tajikistan to become educated.  Farangis needs to pay for her tuition, but she does not have enough money.  She is asking for a loan to make her tuition payment.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana,  una joven madre trabajadora quien junto a su marido e hijos busca como salir adelante, el esposo se desempeña en construcción, sus hijos están estudiando los tiene en un colegio público para ajustarse a su bolsillo, ella continua con su labor como empelada domestica desde hace muchos años, Ana a pesar de su bajo ingreso económico busca como hacerle mejoras a su hogar, esta vez desea construir el muro frontal de su casa, para garantizar la seguridad de su familia, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Ana is a young, hardworking mother who together with her husband and children is looking to get ahead. Her husband works in construction, her children are in school. She has them in a public school to save money. She continues to work as a maid, which she has done for many years. Despite her low income, Ana is seeking to do some home improvements. This time, she wants to build a wall in front of her house to guarantee her family's security. security. That is why she is asking for the loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron bars and gravel.

loans.name: Elvis Jose

texts.es: Elvis, es un joven de 28 años de edad, habita en carretera nueva a León  su esposa es ama de casa, tiene un hijo de 3 añitos ellos dependen de él ya que solamente él trabaja en una empresa en venta de repuestos  de vehículos. Elvis tiene todos los deseos de superarse junto a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para continuar la construcción de su casa, por lo que  solicita el crédito para hacer una pared, dejando pendientes techo, puertas entre otros de necesidad, ya que sus ingresos le permiten ir poco a poco, está muy contento porque está avanzando y podrá ofrecerle a su familia un hogar seguro.
texts.en: Elvis is a 28 year old young man. He lives on the new highway to León. His wife is a housewife. He has a 3 year old son. They depend on him, since he is the only one who is working, in a business that sells car parts. Elvis really wants to get ahead with his family. The loan he is asking for is to continue construction on his house. He is asking for the loan to build a wall, letting the roof, doors and other necessary things wait. His income only allows him to go little by little. He is happy because it is advancing and he can offer his family a safe home.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron rods, blocks and sand.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yessenia, una mujer  muy trabajadora que busca como salir a delante junto a su esposo con su pequeño negocio de ferretería desde hace años, ellos tienen a su cargo a dos de sus hijos quienes están estudiando, el mayor de 20 años es independiente a quien le han inculcado una buena educación, doña Yessenia todas las mañanas se traslada con su esposo de la casa hasta el mercado donde tiene ubicado el negocio para poder hacer la venta del día. El crédito que solicita es par a invertir nuevamente en su negocio que es el único medio de ingresos para continuar con los diferentes gastos familiar, que son inevitables. Ella en un futuro espera acondicionar mejor su tramo, para tener una mejor presentación ante los clientes.
texts.en: Yessenia is a very hardworking woman who is seeking to get ahead with her husband in their small business, a hardware store they have had for years. They are raising two children who are in school. The oldest is 20 and is on his own and they have given him a good education. Every morning Yessenia goes with her husband from their home to the market where they have their business to do the day's sales. The loan she is asking for is to invest again in her business, which is the only source of income to pay for the family's expenses, which are inevitable. In the future, she hopes to outfit her section better, so it can be more attractive to the customers.

loans.use: to buy various wrenches, screwdrivers, hoses, lamps, locks and more.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 48-year-old man with six children. He describes himself as reliable. Charles operates a timber stall where he sells timber. His business is located in a  location with plenty of customers, and his primary customers are construction companies. 

Charles describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of enough stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more timber to sell. His business goal is to own a timber yard within five years. This is the client's first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the profits to pay his rent and his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 57-year-old woman with four children ranging in age from 28 to 34. She describes herself as honest and successful. She operates a grocery stall where she sells sweet potatoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a location with plenty of customers, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as having a shortage of potatoes when it rains. 

Roselyne will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more sweet potatoes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to employ new workers.This is the client's second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a Kiva borrower who has three children ranging in age from 13 to 23. She operates a charcoal and firewood business where she sells charcoal and firewood. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a location with plenty of customers, and her primary customers are retailers and individuals. 

Petronila describes her biggest business challenges as fire disasters and floods. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell. This is the client's third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén, es un padre responsable que se preocupa por su familia, su hija cada dia va creciendo ya está por ingresar a la universidad y esto es una gran preocupación para don Rubén porque tiene que ver cómo equilibrar sus gastos para poder pagar los estudios superiores de su hija, ya que el negocio de pulpería le genera muy pocos ingresos, es por eso que también se está dedicando a taxear para ayudar más a su familia. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio que atiende su esposa, con más productos básicos de mayor demanda.
texts.en: Rubén is a responsible father who worries about his family. his daughter is growing every day and is about to enter college. This is a great source of worry for Rubén, because he has to figure out how to balance expenses to be able to pay for his daughter's college tuition. The small grocery store business generates very little income. That is why he is also driving a taxi, to help his family more. He is asking for the loan to invest in the business that his wife runs, to have more basic products that are in the highest demand.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cereals, dairy products, snacks and eggs.

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es: Karen, es una joven que busca como salir adelante con su familia, su esposo continua trabajando como taxista, sus hijos cada vez más grandes, ella renuncio a su trabajo anterior como promotora de venta, ahora de dedica a trabajar en costura junto a su mamá, ambas confeccionan diferentes tipos de trajes de niños, adultos dependiendo de la solicitud del cliente. Karen solicita el crédito para invertir en este nuevo negocio que ha empezado, con el que busca como prosperar para garantizar la educación de sus hijos, ella necesita comprar materia prima como telas hilos y accesorios varios para continuar.
texts.en: Karen is a young woman who is looking to get ahead in life together with her family.  Her husband continues working as a taxi driver and their children are still growing.  Karen gave up her previous job as a sales promoter and now she sews with her mom.  They both make different types of outfits for children and adults, depending on their customers' request.  Karen is requesting this loan to invest in the new business that she has started which she hopes will prosper so that she can guarantee her children an education.  She needs to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread and various other accessories in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles and various accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 58-year-old man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 6 to 25. He describes himself as having the ability to do more business. He operates a business in which he charges customers a fee to use toilets. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a  location with plenty of customers, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the rain, which makes customers scarce. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to boost the hygiene of his toilets by buying cleaning materials. He will use the anticipated profits to feed his children and pay their school fees. This is the client's second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid back successfully.

loans.use: to boost the hygiene of his toilets by buying cleaning materials.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a 53-year-old man. He describes himself as active. He operates a business in which he customers use his toilets at a fee. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a  location with plenty of customers and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as access to water. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy water and provide better hygiene in his toilets. His business goal is to be able to distribute portable toilets within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to put up more toilets. This is the client's second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid off successfully.

loans.use: buy water and provide better hygiene in his toilets.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, a mother of three, is a business lady who resides in the Mukuru informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. She owns several business entities, including a transportation company and rental property. Due to the successes of her businesses, she now would like to focus her business ventures on making a positive social impact. 

Millicent learned about Fresh Life from a friend and a close business acquaintance. She is seeking a loan to fund the purchase of two Fresh Life Toilets. Her aim in purchasing these toilets is to provide better sanitation for her community and increase her annual returns as a business lady.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs and her chickens.

loans.name: Ayda Merilin

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Ayda, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  5 y 3 años de edad, el mayor este año empieza la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Aida es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta.  También cría pollos en su casa los mismos que entrega a comerciantes cuando ya están listos para la venta. Trabaja en sus ventas tres  días a la semana más que todo en las noches cuando su esposo llega del trabajo y puede quedarse con los niños, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada sábado. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Portoviejo  cada vez  que necesita.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The "María Inmaculada" communal bank meets every fortnight in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish, a canton known for its famous straw hats that are recognised at both national and international levels.

Ayda lives here.  She is 25 years old, is married and has two children - aged five and three years old - with her husband.  Ayda's oldest child will start school this year and her husband works in a factory in Manta.   

Ayda is a very good housewife who, in order to earn some money on her own, has a business selling all types of clothes and costume jewellery.  She sells door-to-door and, in addition, she raises chickens at home, which she then sells to businesses when the chickens are old enough.  Ayda makes her sales three days a week, mostly in the evenings when her husband returns home from work and can look after the children. Her customers pay on credit, with Ayda going round to collect every Saturday.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo when she needs it.

Ayda is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts and children's clothes.  She has been part of the communal bank since the beginning and likes it as it was with her first loan that she started her business.

Ayda's dream is to have her own house as she currently resides at her mother's house.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Malach

texts.en:
Malach lives outside of Butere, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Malach, who is unmarried, has been farming for four years, currently growing vegetables of various types on his land. Malach is excited to work with Honey Care because they provide good services, and is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because it is "a manageable project" that will not require too much of his time.

This is Malach's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehive to help him start a small business. In the future, he hopes to continue to grow the number and typse of projects he is engaged in, and to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Бобомурод женатый мужчина. Ему 40 лет. Он отец пятерых детей. Бобомурод со своей семьей живет и трудится в районе Руми. Его сын находится в России на заработках. У Бобомурода среднее образование. Он занимается земледелием. Сейчас Бобомурод хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он планирует заняться куплей и продажей мелко-рогатого скота. У него при дворе дома имеется сарай для содержания скота. Он берет кредит для закупа трех голов овец, чтобы приступить к деятельности. Бобомурод за счет полученной выручки хочет сыграть свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Bobomurod is 40, married, and the father of five. He works lives with his family in Rumy. His son is working in Russia. He has a high school diploma, and is involved in farming. Now he wants to start a business in animal husbandry. He plans to buy, fatten, and resell sheep. He has a shed in his yard where he can keep the animals. He is requesting a loan to buy three head of sheep in order to get the business started. He wants to use the income received with the loan to pay for his son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy three head of sheep and feed

loans.name: Elena Doraliza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Elena tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales son gemelos y tienen 3 años. Su esposo es maestro en una escuela de la localidad.

Doña Elena tiene una pequeña papelería en su casa donde vende útiles escolares y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos y gallinas pero esto es más para consumo personal aunque de vez en cuando vende algunos de sus animalitos a  sus vecinos. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad, actualmente lo que más está vendiendo son los útiles escolares ya que es inicio de clases y es lo que más se vende.
	
Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de útiles escolares y así aprovechar la época que es cuando mejores ganancias le deja. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. 

Su meta es seguir adelante aumentando  su negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group María Inmaculada meets every fifteen days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, an area known for the famous Panama hats that are appreciated by those both inside and outside of the country.

Elena is forty years old, is married, and has two sons, who are three-year-old twins.  Her husband is a teacher at a local school.

Elena has a small paper store in her home where she sells school supplies and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day.  Her products are sold on credit and she charges every week.  She also makes a living raising pigs and chickens; this is more for personal consumption, however from time to time she sells some of her small animals to her neighbors.  She has more than twelve years of experience in this work.  Presently, she is selling mostly school supplies, since classes have just begun.  

This loan is to buy all types of school supplies, and to thereby take advantage of the time of year when she can make the best profits.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are quick.

Her goal is to continue moving forward and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Chorshami

texts.ru: Чоршами проживает в районе Руми. Ему 43 года. Он женат и у него четверо детей. Он имеет только среднее образование. Чоршами добрый и отзывчивый человек. Чоршами вместе с женой в течение нескольких лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Чоршами хочет начать новый бизнес в области животноводства и таким образом улучшить семейный бюджет. Он планирует заняться куплей и продажей мелко-рогатого скота. Чоршами запрашивает кредит для закупа овец с целью дальнейшего откорма и продажи. За счет прибыли он хочет совершить обряд обрезания сына.
texts.en: Chorsami lives in Rumy. He is 43, married, and has four children. He has only a high school diploma. Chorshami is a kind and warm person. He has farmed together with his wife for several years. He wants to start a new business raising livestock, and thereby improve his family's financial situation. Chorshami is requesting a loan to buy sheep to fatten and resell them. He wants to use the income received with the loan to pay for his son's circumcision ceremony.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and later resale

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфару 25 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 дочь, которой 2 года. Нилуфар работает в поликлинике начальником отдела кадров. Она со студенческих лет параллельно работала в поликлинике в качестве рядового сотрудника. Она работает честно и качественно, и ее упорный труд дал ей шанс за короткий срок достичь высот по карьерной лестнице. Она  скоро родить второго ребенка и поэтому до рождения малыша она собирается отремонтировать свою 5 комнатную квартиру. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, обои, клей и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nilufar is 25, married, and has one two year-old daughter. She works as the chief of staff in a clinic, where she has also doubled as a regular staff member since her days as a student. She is a very good employee, and her hard work has enabled her to climb high on the career ladder in a short amount of time. Soon she will give birth to her second child, and before that she wants to renovate her five-room flat. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to buy building materials, such as paint, wallpaper, glue, etc. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her flat

loans.name: Mónica Katiuska

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 1 año. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.

Doña Mónica es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de tres  a cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución, negocio que le permite ganar sus propios recursos con los cuales ayuda a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita in Montecristi, a canton known for its famous straw hats that are appreciated inside and outside of the country.  Señora Mónica lives in this place.  She is 25, married, and from this relationship has a one-year-old son.  Her husband works in a factory in town.

Doña Mónica is housewife who, in order to get her own resources, makes a living by selling clothing from a catalog and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She works three to four days a week, selling her products by credit and collecting every weekend.  She began her business with the first loan that she received from the institution; a business that allows her to earn her own resources with which to help her spouse with the costs generated by the home.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing in general.  Since the beginning she has been with the communal bank and likes it because with the loans she is able to get ahead in life. 

Her dreams are to succeed and provide the best for her baby.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 65-year-old married man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is agriculture, alongside selling fresh vegetables. He faces hardship of low prices for agricultural produce, while his vision is to add value to his products by processing them, and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sangai

texts.en:
Sangai is 24 years old and lives and works in Bardnersille.  Bardnersville is one of the oldest communities in Liberia, and is known for their fish because of its location by a river. It is a suburb located just outside Monrovia and is one of the poorer areas.  You will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Sangai is married and has a four-year-old child, who is attending school and lives at home.  Sangai did not go to school; her husband is a builder. 

For the past six years, Sangai has been selling pepper, rice, oil, etc.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. 

She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit, and has more customers.  

She hopes to build a house and a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Meme

texts.en:
Meme is a businesswoman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children, aged between 20 and 16. Two of her children are currently attending school and live at home.  She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as working woman.

She lives and works in Bardnersville.  Bardnersville is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find residents living in sub-standard housing. 

For the past two years, Meme has had a table business which sells fish.  She works ten hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is a small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 40 year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is single and has five children, aged between 26 and 14. Three of her children are currently attending school and live at home.  She completed grade 6th before starting her business.  She describes herself as working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find residents living in sub-standard housing. 

For the past ten years, Patricia has had a table business which sells sugar, palm oil, rice, etc.  She works ten hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is a small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mabel is a 47 year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is single and has nine children, aged between 24 and 13. Only two of her children are currently attending school and live at home.  She was a college student, and she is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as working woman.

She lives and works in Bardnersville.  Bardnersville is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find residents living in sub-standard housing. 

For the past ten years, Mabel has had a table business which sells palm oil, rice, etc.  She works ten hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is a small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago mayor de edad con cuatro hijos mayores de edad originario de unos de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, Santiago posee varias actividades como son crianza y engorde de ceros(compra venta) compra venta y crianza de gallinas de patio, asi como tambien panaderia el cual solo trabajan con pan dulce dos veces por semana, las compras de cerdos y gallinas las realiza en el  campo o en comarcas aledañas donde vive por lo general las vende al contado a clientes eventuales y tambien da al credito a clientes fijos estos los recupera semanal, negocio el cual lo inicia con dinero propio para mejorar los ingresos de su hogar el cual a medida que iva incrementado su negocio realizaba otros para tener mayores utilizades y asi invertia en otro negocio rentable es asi como el ahora posee estos negocios los cuales con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios ha logrado salir adelante, unos de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su casa y ampliar aun mas sus negocio, el objetivo de credito es para capital de trabajo en compra de cerdos en pie, arina, manteca, entre otros productos mas.
texts.en: Santiago is an adult with four grown children. He is from one of the towns of Chinandega located in the western part part of the country. Santiago does different activities such as raising pigs (buying and selling), buying and selling chickens, as well as a bread bakery, where he only works with sweet bread twice a week. He buys his pigs and chickens in the country or in communities nearby where he lives. In general, he sells them for cash upfront to non-regular customers and on credit to regular customers, which he collects weekly. He started this business with his own money to improve the household income. As his business grew he did others to have more profits and invest in another profitable business. That is how he has these businesses now which, with much hard work and sacrifice he has been able to get ahead. One of his dreams is to be able to finish building his house and expanding his businesses even more. The purpose of the loan to for working capital to buy live pigs, flour, lard, and more products.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy live pigs, lard, flour, salt and more.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta is a 42-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has four children, between 17 and 4. Her four are currently attending school and live at home. She did not go to school and started her business to make a living. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in substandard housing. 

Miatta has a table business where she has sold charcoal for the past ten years. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She works ten hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is insufficient income. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more charcoal for her business.She hopes to one day own a house.
  
Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Faty Mu Ndaw's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 17 membres qui habitent le même village et font comme activité le commerce.Fatou Mu Ndaw la responsable du groupe est mariée; âgée de 39 ans elle en charge 04 enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. Elle s'active dans le commerce  de savon,d'encens. Elle est debout à droite avec un beau sourire et a levé la main gauche. Elle compte acheter pour 25000F d'encens et le reste 35000F du savon. Avec le bénéfice elle va renforcer son épargne, économiser pour pouvoir construire une petite boutique.
texts.en: This group consists of 17 members who live in the same village and work in trade. They are represented by Faty Mu Ndaw, a 39-year-old married woman with four children in her care, two boys and two girls. She sells incense and soap. In the photo, she is standing at the far right with a lovely smile and her left hand raised. She plans to purchase 25,000F worth of incense and 35,000F worth of soap. She will use her profits to bolster her savings, and someday build a small store.

loans.use: to buy incense and soap for resale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 45-year-old farmer. She lives with her husband in the village of Ddmashen, which is in the Sevan area. Flora has two sons. The elder one is a military man; the second son is in the Russian Federation, working abroad. Flora has never worked outside the farm. Her whole life Flora has engaged in agricultural business. 

She grows vegetables and fruits in her garden, which her husband sells in the Sevan fruit markets. She has also a large barn for animals and breeds cows, sheep and chickens. Flora also has 20 beehives and the honey from her farm is most popular in the Sevan area. 

Flora is a very hardworking lady and she makes very tasty cheese from her animals' milk and sells it to resellers from Yerevan. The income from farming and land cultivating allows Flora to sustain her family. Her younger son from time to time helps Flora from Russia and shares his family's bills in Armenia.

Flora likes her rural occupation and she confessed that agriculture is very hard but at the same time a very pleasant and profitable business.
 
Flora needs a loan to buy calves and fodder for her animals. This is the first loan from Kiva for Flora and she hopes to cooperate with Nor Horizon and Kiva again.

loans.use: To buy calves and fodder for her animals.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Maria, habita en el municipio de San Ignacio,  junto a su familia, su esposo al igual que ella son comerciantes desde hace mas de 10 años venden frutas y verduras en los distintos departamentos del pais, sus planes a futuro es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con las ganancias que obtienen queren terminar de construir su casa pero muchas veces se les presentan dificultades por lo que se le ha hecho dificil, con este credito comprara Materiales de Cosntruccion como: Cemento, Bloques, Hierro, Arena, Piedrin etc, con  esto podra terminar de construir su casa humilde, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic en Conjunto a Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Maria lives in the town of San Ignacio with her family. Both she and her husband have been merchants for more than 10 years, selling fruits and vegetables in the country’s various departments. Their plan for the future is to improve their living conditions. With the earnings they make, they want to finish constructing their house, but they have faced many hardships that have made it difficult. With this loan, Maria will buy construction materials, such as cement, blocks, iron, sand, stone, etc. With these materials, she will be able to finish constructing her humble home. Maria is grateful for the help of Afodenic and the Kiva funds she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sue B.

texts.en:
Sue B. is a 47 year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is divorced and has four children, aged between 32 and 11. Only two of her children are currently attending school and live at home.  She completed 12th grade before joining business.  She describes herself as working woman.

She lives and works in the St. Paul area.  St.Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

For the past ten years, Sue B. has had a table business which sells milk, sugar, candles, etc.  She works ten hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is a small income. She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has four children, aged between 19 and 12. Only two of her children are currently attending school and live at home.  She did not go to school, and joined business to make her life easier.  She describes herself as working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find residents living in sub-standard housing. 

For the past ten years, Rebecca has had a table business which sells slippers, body cream, etc..  She works ten hours a day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is a small income. She intends to use the loan to buy more slippers, body cream, etc. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy more slippers, body cream etc.

loans.name: Naoh

texts.en:
Naoh is a 30-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is single and has four children between 11 and 7 months old who live at home. Three of her children are currently attending school. She was not fortunate to go to school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman.

She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in substandard housing.
 
Naoh has a table business where she has sold dry and fresh fish in the local market for the past 14 years. She started her business by selling for her friends. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She works ten hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is small income. 

She intends to use the loan to buy inventory. She hopes to one day own a house.
  
Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a charming 31-year-old lady who is engaged in animal breeding. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Sevan. Her husband is a driver and works hard days and nights in order to sustain his family, so Susanna is in charge of the upbringing of their children. 

Susanna has a higher education and for five years she used to work as an accountant in Sevan. But for more than two years she has been jobless and so she raises cows, bulls and chickens at her farm. The products from farming Susanna sells in the Sevan food markets. She says that raising animals is a very hard occupation, especially for women, but at the same time it is very profitable. Susanna does her best to ensure a good future for her children.

Susanna decided to increase the number of her animals and for this she asks a loan from Kiva lenders to buy two calves and fodder for animals. This is the sixth loan from Nor Horizon for Susanna and the first one from Kiva, and she hopes that her first deal with Kiva will have a good success for her agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy two calves and fodder for animals.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 31 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school. Leah works very hard to provide for her family.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 10 years.

Leah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, bread, etc.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Lorna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase food and household goods like canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purcahse food and household goods like canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman who has four children ranging in age from 17 to 26 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

Christine operates a store where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located where there are plenty of customers and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds for expansion. 

Christine will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more drinks for sale in her store. Her business goal is to own multiple businesses within five years. This is the client's first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is the only breadwinner in his family. He is 32 years old and lives with her mother in Sevan city. His mother is jobless. 

Ashot has to work hard day and night in order to meet his family's needs. He works in a Sevan gas station as an operator. At the same time, Ashot runs his own business. He has rented a place where he performs his car-wash service. He has found many customers in a short time. So he needs a loan to buy a special tool for car washing (a Karcher pressure washer) that will help him to increase the quality of his service.

loans.use: To buy a special tool for car washing.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
For young biologist Arman this is the third loan from Kiva. First, he sends his kind greetings to all of his Kiva lenders and says a big thank you for their support. 

Arman is still engaged in the clothes-trading business in his rented stall in the clothes market of Vanadzor city. He is the only breadwinner in his small family. His wife is in charge of the upbringing of their son. As Arman confessed, after two loans from Nor Horizon and Kiva, his business is going well and he enlarged the assortment of his clothes. He buys men’s clothes from Yerevan wholesale markets and resells them in his stall in Vanadzor.
 
This time, Arman decided to buy a new summer clothes assortment from Georgia and transport them for reselling in to Vanadzor city. For this he asks a loan from Kiva and hopes for his Kiva lenders' big support.

loans.use: To buy a new summer clothes assortment from Georgia and transport them for reselling.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune, a 35-year-old teacher of the English language, lives with her pensioner father in Vanadzor city. Since university graduation, Nune has worked as an English teacher in Vanadzor high school. At the same time, she is also the deputy director of that school. 

Nune also organized individual English tutoring in her house for students and adults who want to learn English. She also does translations for orders. As she confessed, her days are very full but she likes her job and does it with great pleasure and receives a good profit from her individual tutoring. 

Nune needs a loan to buy a computer, which will allow her to increase the quality of her teaching process.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is 50 years old, married, and has 9 children who are in school.

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like sugar, coffee, noodles, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Macaria has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending, raising goats and chickens, and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Macaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like sugar, coffee, noodles, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 60 years old and married with one child.

Ester works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and reselling nipa (woven palm mats, used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a 10,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Ester has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 20 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Ester aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Mea

texts.en:
Mea works hard to support her family. Mea is married and has a spice business in the Philippines.

Mea requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of spices like ginger, onions, garlic, etc. to sell.

Mea has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Mea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spices like ginger, onions, garlic, etc to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has a business selling snack foods in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more snack foods to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for six years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 44 years old and married, with five children. With three children in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Susana has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soft drinks, soap, bread, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lorelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales. Lorelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lorelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling fruit. Zenaida requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Zenaida has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe PS est composé de deux femmes qui habitent le même village et s'activent dans le commerce.

La représentante, Sokhna a bénéficié de 8 prêts du compte externe qu'elle a toujours remboursé sans difficultés, elle est sérieuse et très dynamique dans son travail. C'est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans elle est mère de quatre enfants dont un garçon.Elle s'active dans le commerce de marchandises diverses. Sur la photo elle est à droite vêtue de rose-bleu.

Elle se ravitaille en marchandises(chaussures, habits,parfums, encens,tissus etc.....)dans les différents marchés proches du village, à Guéoul ou Louga pour revendre dans sa localité.

Elle compte avec son prêt acheter différentes marchandises le tout pour une valeur de 225000 F et pense pouvoir se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Avec les bénéfices elle va renforcer son épargne, aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
This PS group consists of two women who live in the same village and work in trade. They are represented by Sokhna, who previously benefited from 8 loans from the external account, which she repaid without difficulty. She takes her work seriously and shows great enthusiasm. At age 39, she is a married mother of four children including one boy. She sells a diverse assortment of merchandise. She is on the right in the photo, dressed in blue and pink.

She buys her stock (shoes, clothing, perfumes, incense, fabrics, etc.) at various markets in the vicinity of her village, in Guéoul or Louga, and she conducts her sales in her neighborhood. 

She plans to use her loan to buy 225,000 F worth of merchandise, and she anticipates earning substantial income.
