She will use her profits to bolster her savings and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 56 years old and married with 10 children.

Segundina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Segundina has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Segundina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business producing shrimp paste in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her shrimp paste making.

Pilar successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Pilar's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her shrimp paste production.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Edna is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production for her food vending business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 47 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. 

Felicidad is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and medicine for her chickens.

Felicidad has been raising chickens for 25 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her chickens.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 26 years.

Leni is requesting another loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 22 years old, married, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Melanie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She sells tobacco in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.  

Violeta is requesting her fifth loan from NWFT for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Winefreda has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from making native hats.

Winefreda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and married, with five children. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, detergent, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es: Claudia, es habitante de Ciudad Sandino ubicado a 10 minutos de Managua, es soltera no tiene hijos aun, es licenciada en administración de empresas pero por la falta de oportunidad de empleo ejerce el comercio con una pequeña pulpería, con la que intenta salir adelante para apoyarse en sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres quienes son ancianos, es por eso que solicita el crédito para invertir en granos básicos, verduras, frutas para llevar a cabo sus ventas, siendo su único medio de ingresos.
texts.en: Claudia lives in Ciudad Sandino, 10 minutes from Managua.  She is single and doesn't yet have any children.  Claudia has a degree in business administration but, owing to a lack of job opportunities, she is running her own small convenience store and attempting to make progress in order to cover her expenses and help her elderly parents.  She is requesting a loan to invest in basic grains, vegetables and fruit so that she can continue making her sales.  This is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Davaajargal

texts.en:
Davaajargal is 53 years old lives with his wife and three children in small house in Tosontsengel soum, Zavhan province, Mongolia. His older children help their parents to run their business and his younger son studies at university. Since she retired, Davaajargal's wife, Byambajargal, has been staying home taking care of family. She is now starting a small grocery business to increase the family's income. She has rented a small store and will operate it with the help of her husband and children. 

Davaajargal is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to help his wife start her grocery store. Her loan will help support his family. Davaajargal and Byambajargal are hardworking and responsible people.

loans.use: to help his wife start a small grocery store

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers.

Bernardita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Bernadita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Kristofel

texts.en:
Kristofel is a 40-year-old farmer and is married to Novri, a 34-year-old woman. From the marriage, they are blessed with a son named Kevin, 7, who is in the first grade of elementary school.

Kristofel has been working as a farmer for years. He cultivates a paddy, but only in the rainy season. In order to make more money for his family needs, Kristofel also catches fish and shrimp to resell to retailers. Kristofel plans to buy nets and to develop a large canoe for fishing.

Therefore, he has requested a loan from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM), amounting of IDR 10,000,000. Kristofel is hoping that TLM will help him, through the loan assistance, to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy nets and develop a large canoe for fishing.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is married and she works hard to support her family. 

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from hog-raising.  Florencia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno agrícola de 4 hectáreas en donde cultiva cacao orgánico , lleva en este negocio un promedio de 19 años y hasta ahora le sigue dando muy buenos resultados.Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura de sus padres quienes también le cedieron una pequeña parcela de cacao cuando decidió independizarse . Al generar sus propios ingresos logró ahorrar y comprar el resto de las parcelas que tiene actualmente.Para facilitar el trabajo que realiza contrata trabajadores del lugar esperando terminar las diversas tareas en menor tiempo y así dar un mantenimiento uniforme a sus cultivos. Asimismo debe aplicar fingidas para evitar que algunas malezas  perjudiquen el normal crecimiento de sus árboles de cacao.
Desea seguir ampliando sus terrenos comprando parcelas vecinas para mejorar sus ganancias y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta lograr que sean profesionales algún día.En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar un terreno agrícola adicional.
texts.en:
Francisca is 41 years old, married, and has four children with whom she lives in her own home which is built from adobe.  Francisca farms 4 hectares of land where she grows organic cacao.  She has been in this business for around 19 years and, up to now, she has had very good results.  She learned how to farm from her parents who also gave her a small plot of cacao when she decided to start working independently.  As she started making her own income, Francisca saved up and bought the rest of the plots that she currently owns.  To make her work easier, she hires local workers so that she can finish her different tasks in less time which means that she is able to provide uniform maintenance to all her crops.  She must also apply fungicides in order to avoid certain weeds from damaging the normal growth of her cacao trees.

Francisca would like to continue increasing the amount of farmland she owns, buying neighboring plots in order to improve her profits and support her children with their schooling until they become professionals some day.  On this occasion, she would like to borrow 3,000 soles to buy an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 58 years old and married with one kid. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food, and other groceries. Leonora works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonora is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past 13 years she has operated a trisikad (tricycle) transportation business in the Philippines. Liza is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liza is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional vehicle. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional vehicle

loans.name: Ma. Merla

texts.en:
Ma. Merla is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past three years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines.

Ma. Merla is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 38 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Paz has a general store business in the Philippines. Paz requested a 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items like sardines, soap, detergent, snack foods and other groceries.

Paz has been in this business for six years. In the future, Paz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, soap, detergent, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Glorince

texts.en:
Glorince is 25 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer. Glorince has a business selling Se'i pork (grilled and smoked pork), which she has been doing for five years.  She.started the business with her own capital.

Glorince is requesting a loan for 6,000,000 IDR, which she will use to buy more meat. She is expecting that TLM will assist her to improve her
business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 57 years old and married, with four children.

Josefina is in the weaving business, abaca-weaving in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

Josefina has been abaca-weaving for 19 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 50-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, three daughters, and two sons in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Since 2003, her husband has had a general store and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that, his wife, Bashiran, as a member of three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, like flour, sugar, pulses, and detergent, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his net income.

Bashiran and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, pulses, and detergent to sell.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила занимается продажей различных товаров. Начинала она с продажи автомобильных масел и красок, затем добавила канцтовары. Это сезонный бизнес, хорошо идет, когда дети идут в школу. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Людмила смогла открыть еще одно направление - продажа фотоальбомов. Это также сезонный бизнес, который хорошо идет летом, когда многие люди ездят в отпуска, делают фотографии и затем покупают альбомы. Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит на увеличение ассортимента товара. Она собирается потратить большую часть суммы на закупку альбомов, а также увеличить ассортимент масел и красок. Людмила намерена развивать свой бизнес и дальше, ища новые успешные направления.
texts.en:
Ludmila sells various goods.  She started selling motor oils and paints and then expanded her activity to include office supplies.  This seasonal business is going quite well and it allows her to work when the children are in school.

Thanks to her previous loan, Ludmila was able to further diversify her activity and she started selling photo albums.  This is also a seasonal business, which is profitable in the summer when many people go on vacation, take pictures, and then buy albums.

Ludmila is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of goods.  She's going to spend a large part of the amount for the purchase of albums, as well as increase the assortment of oils and paints. Lyudmila intends to further develop her activity and is looking for other new, successful business opportunities.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of photo albums, motor oils and paints

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarmagnai, 43 years old, lives with his wife and child in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He, together with his wife, has been transporting goods between Erdenet and other cities for eight years and has secured permanent customers for his business. His son goes to high school. 

Mr. Bayarmagnai's current truck has been deteriorating over the years and became out of service. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a new truck. The new truck will ensure his business's success and prevent his customers from choosing another driver. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who, before transportation service, worked in Japan on an employment contract in order to pay for his family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck

loans.name: Munkhdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhdorj, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been supplying equipment to pure water and juice factories for ten years. He imports equipment from China and when the equipment comes to the port city, he collects it and sells it to factories. He doesn't just sell it but also installs equipment at the factory. 

Mr. Munkhdorj's wife has gotten her maternity leave and currently she is staying at home. His two children both go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to import equipment from China that his clients have ordered. The borrower has been doing his business for many years and has accumulated vast amount of experience. Before this job, he worked as an engineer at a pure water and juice factory.

loans.use: to import and install equipment from China

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Candelaria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Candelaria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erdenetuul

texts.en:
Erdenetuul, 55 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a rental apartment. For the past 13 years, Erdenetuul has been running a supermarket and she has accumulated vast amount of experience. Her husband is disabled. His health condition is getting better daily; now he walks, speaks, and does things on his own. Erdenetuul used her previous loan to expand her supermarket and diversify the products she offers.

Erdenetuul is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase building and insulation materials to repair and insulate an old house and leave her apartment. She lives in a ger district, rural area where central heating and sanitation systems are rare. Erdenetuul thinks that, instead of living in an apartment where the heat is stopped during the summer time, it is better for her husband's health to live in a house. She is aware that a renovated house won't require a large amount of heating coal and it is way better for preserving energy. Erdenetuul is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and insulation

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45 year old housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her four children. Her husband owns a small hotel in the market, which is the only source of income for their family. He is an expert at cooking and his delicious food is liked by everyone.

Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will purchase food products including chicken, beef, breads, pulses, vegetables and oil. Nasreen wants to save money for her children's education with the profit amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food products including chicken, beef, breads, pulses, vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria es una mujer de 33 años en una relación en unión libre y madre de 2 hijos los cuales trabajan y ayudan con las diferentes actividades que se llevan a cabo en el campo junto a su padre. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primario no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado y no pudo continuar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y los ingresos eran distribuidos en la alimentación, la vestimenta y medicina con muchas restricciones. Ella no solo es agricultora si no también comerciante ya que tiene una pequeña pulpería con la que ayuda a su pareja con los gastos en el hogar ya que antes del negocio se veían en apuros en ocasiones ya que los ingresos por parte del campo eran pocos. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual en ocasiones se trasportan en vehículo y otras a pie por los altos costos del combustible. 

Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que ayudaran a fortalecer sus cultivos de café y a sacar una cosecha segura y limpia.

Su meta es mejorar sus cultivos de café los cuales son de gran beneficio para su familia al momento de elaborar y sacar una excelente cosecha como la que hoy está produciendo y cultivando. Su sueño es agrandar más sus cultivos para que de esa forma sus hijos puedan trabajar independiente mente y puedan cultivar más variedad ya que ellos heredaran las tierras que hoy en día trabajan.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who work and help their parents with their different tasks in the fields.  Gregoria did not complete her primary education, studying only up to her fourth year.  She could not continue her studies because her parents were poor and their income was spent on food, clothing and medicine, with many restrictions.  Gregoria is not only a farmer but also a saleswoman as she has a small convenience store that she runs in order to help her partner with their household expenses.  Before she started that business the couple occasionally found themselves in a tight spot as the income they made from farming was not much.  Gregoria's crops are located some 2 kilometers from her home.  Sometimes she travels there by vehicle and sometimes on foot owing to the high cost of fuel.

Gregoria currently needs help to buy manure, fertilizers and other inputs that will help to strengthen her coffee crops and ensure she enjoys a safe and clean harvest.

Gregoria's goal is to improve her coffee crops as they are a great help to her family when she enjoys an excellent harvest such as the one she is currently growing and producing.  Gregoria's dream is to further expand her plantings so that her children can work independently and grow a greater variety of crops because they will inherit the land that they are currently working.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and other inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: María Hercilia

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a cultivar granos básicos junto a su compañero de vida. Antes comercializaba con cerdos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 bolsas de cemento y dos pliegos de lámina para la puerta y el resto del dinero para comprar el ladrillo para el piso. De esta manera, terminara de construir su casa ya que hace varios meses deseaba hacer estos arreglos en su vivienda. Otro objetivo que tiene es construir una galera para  instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She lives with her partner and has four children.  She does her housework and grows basic grains together with her partner.  In the past she sold pigs.

María is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy 10 bags of cement and two sheets of metal for the door.  She will spend the rest of the money on bricks for the floor.  In this way, she will finish building her house.  She has wanted to carry out this work on her home for several months.  Another goal she has is to build a shed so that she can set up a farm of both laying hens and hens for meat.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of cement and two sheets of metal for the door.  The rest of the money will be used to buy bricks for the floor.

loans.name: Teresa Dominga

texts.es: Junto a su esposo doña Teresa, busca como salir adelante con su familia, hoy en día sus hijos son mayores de edad, ella continúa con su labor como conserje ingreos que con dificultad le da para pagar sus principales gastos de consumo, por lo que poco a poco quiere mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Este nuevo crédito le vendrá muy bien para terminar de hacer una pared que aun le hace falta, por el momento es de madera y necesita ir haciéndola de concreto para garantizar la seguridad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Teresa and her husband struggle to get ahead with their family. Their children are now adults and she continues working as a caretaker. Her income is barely enough to cover the expenses, but she wants to improve her house little by little.

This new loan will be very useful to build a wall that the house lacks. For the moment, it is made of wood, but she needs to build it in concrete in order to guarantee safer conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna is 39 years old and married with one child. Dyna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Dyna has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Dyna aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ernalen

texts.en:
Ernalen is 44 years old, married and has four children who are all in school. Ernalen is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Ernalen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her chickens.

Ernalen has been raising chickens for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ernalen would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her chickens.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and five children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been running a souvenir and jewelry sales business since 2004 and her business is doing well. Her husband currently runs a framing workshop; he makes and sells frames to local vendors. 

The house they live in is very small and can't provide enough space for this seven-member family. So Battsetseg is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband will make an extension and add insulation to their house. The renovated and extended house will provide comfortable and spacious accommodation for his family. Also, more importantly, they will reduce their coal consumption and that will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She has a hog raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Beverly is borrowing 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 59 años y es viuda y tiene una casa hecha a base de adobe en donde vive junto a sus 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales trabajan independientemente.Desde joven trabajó en el campo cultivando productos de la zona como el cacao orgánico, café y otros productos apoyando a sus padres.Cuando cumplió la edad suficiente se comprometió y formo su propia familia y  recibiendo por parte de sus suegros un terreno agrícola para  mantener económicamente a sus hijos ha logrado salir adelante pero hace 9 años abrió una pequeña tienda de productos comestibles en el cual trabaja cuando termina sus labores del campo.Para mantener sus plantas en buen estado contrata trabajadores del lugar quienes la apoyan en distintas tareas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha que posteriormente vende a los vendedores del lugar logrando recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales.
En esta ocasión desea contar con S/. 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar sacos de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Julia is 59 years old and a widow.  She has a house made from adobe where she lives together with her four children.  Two of her children work independently.

Julia has worked in the fields since she was a young girl, growing regional produce such as organic cacao, coffee, etc. and supporting her parents.  When she was old enough, she got engaged and formed her own family, receiving a plot of farmland from her in-laws so that she could financially provide for her children.  Julia has managed to make progress.  Nine years ago, she opened a small food store where she works when she finishes her tasks in the fields.  In order to keep her plants in good condition, she hires local workers who support her in different tasks such as weeding and harvesting.  She then sells her crops to local salespeople, thereby recouping the money she originally invested and making additional profits.  

On this occasion, Julia would like to borrow 1,000 soles to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Geisel Patricia

texts.es: Geisel, de 33 años habitante del Reparto Schick en Managua, una zona donde hay mucha delincuencia y pobreza, ella se dedica a vender productos variados de plásticos, junto a su esposo intenta como salir adelante para mantener la educación de sus 2 hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad quienes van a la escuela y requieren de un cuidado especial por el reparto donde habitan. Para Geisel esta es su primera experiencia de crédito con Afodenic, que solicita para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, hará levantado y repello de pared y pondrá cerámica, espera que con este financiamiento pueda cubrir una gran parte de mejoras para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Geisel is 33 years old and lives in the Schick housing development in Managua, which is an area where there is a lot of crime and poverty. She works selling various plastic products. She and her husband are trying to get ahead and keep their two children – ages 11 and 15 – in school. Geisel’s children are currently going to school, but she says they need a lot of special care and attention because of the housing development they live in.

This is Geisel’s first loan with AFODENIC, which she is requesting to improve the condition of her house. She will put up and plaster a wall and install ceramic tiles. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to pay for a large part of her home improvements.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, ceramic tile, blocks and iron.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 37 years old. He lives in Telavi District, Kakheti region with his wife and two children. Solomon requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but did not have any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the small income of Solomon working as an artisan. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Solomon requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Solomon has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Solomon will begin trade with clothing. He plans to go to Turkey and purchase clothing from the wholesalers and then resell at higher prices in Telavi. This will enable him to increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 63 years old, married, and has nine children. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Flordelina requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Flordelina has been raising pigs for 21 years now. She has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory for her natural products business.

loans.name: Miladys Margarita

texts.es: La señora Miladys habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella es comerciante desde 4 años comercializa Muebles como: sillas abuelitas, comodos, Camas, Comedores etc, su compañero le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja para una empresa privada, este credito lo quiere para invertir en la compra de muebles ya que actualmente esta recibiendo mucha demanda de su producto y quiere aprovechar para incrementar su inventario, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondo Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en: Miladys lives in the municipality of Masaya with her life companion and her son.  She’s been a merchant for the last four years.  She sells furniture like rocking chairs, chests of drawers, beds, dining room sets, etc.  Her spouse helps with household expenses since he’s employed by a private firm.  She needs this loan to buy furniture because she has much demand for her product and she wants to take advantage of it by increasing her inventory.  She’s grateful for the support Afodenic in conjunction with Kiva funds is providing her.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Marta Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marta mujer trabajadora y humilde habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su esposo e hijos su planes a futuro es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sobre todo mejorar su humilde casa, el la apoya en todo los proyectos ya que entre los dos tienen su  negocio, vende Calzado para damos en los departamentos del pais, ellos compran al por mayor en el mercado y lo comercializan, negocio el cual les ha dado buenos ingresos que les a servido para lod gastos del Hogar, con este credito compraran Calzado para incrementar sus productos, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado
texts.en: Marta’s a hardworking, humble woman living in the municipality of Masaya with her husband and children.  Her future plan is to be able to improve her living conditions, above all to make improvements to her humble house.  He supports all her projects because the business is both of theirs.  She sells women’s shoes in the country’s departments.  They buy them at wholesale in the market and then resell them.  The business has produced good income that’s helped them cover household expenses.  They will use this loan to buy footwear to increase their products.  She’s grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva funds have provided.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married with eight children.

Gina is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Josephine is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maximiliano Ramiro

texts.es: Maximiliano Ramiro, mayor de edad casado con dos hijos, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietario de una línea de taxi en esta localidad, donde día día lucha por el sustento de su hogar, Maximiliano ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal, desde hace un año ha deseado reparar su vivienda pero por falta de disponibilidad económica no lo había logrado, el objetivo de este crédito es para la remodelación de sus vivienda específicamente desea ponerle cerámica en el corredor de su casa, al igual en la cocina y en uno de los cuartos, Maximiliano solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerámica, cemento, cal, arena entre otros.-
texts.en:
Maximiliano Ramiro is a married adult with two children.  He’s from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country.  He owns a line of taxis in that location where he strives daily to support his home.  Maximiliano has shown himself to be a responsible, hardworking person with a strong drive towards self-improvement.  

He’s wanted to make home improvements for the last year but the lack of economic resources has kept him from doing so.  The objective of this loan is to remodel his house.  Specifically, he’d like to install tile in the hallway of his house as well as in the kitchen and one of the bedrooms.  Maximiliano’s asking for this loan to buy tile, cement, lime powder and sand, among others.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 24-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 5, while the youngest is 4. She runs a variety store. She sells items like noodles, biscuits, soaps, and powdered milk. Her husband is a fisherman. Her husband's catch is a source of income, and at the same time used for the family's daily consumption. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, to improve the volume of catch. In the future, Regina would like to expand her business to support her family and also to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Ladies Of Vision Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Miriam from Masvingo. She is married with three children and two are attending school.  Miriam runs an agriculture business raising chickens. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says her main challenge is a shortage of chicks from their suppliers due to high demand. Miriam has requested a loan of $600 (USD) to buy chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to build a house. In the future Miriam plans to become a major supplier of chickens .

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra , mujer humilde y trabajadora habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , sus planes a futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder realizar mejoras a su humilde casita ,  doña Sandra desde hace varios años se dedica a cultivar piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para un buena producción. Con este nuevo financiamiento  podra invertir en fertilizantes e insumos como: Triple, Completo, Urea etc, para aplicar y así sacar un mejor cosecha .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Sandra is a modest and hard-working woman who lives with her husband and children in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Her plans for the future are to make improvements to their humble home and to improve their living conditions. 

Sandra has earned a living cultivating pineapple for several years. The greatest challenge that she faces is the lack of fertilizers and necessary supplies to produce a good crop. 

With this new loan she will be able to buy fertilizers and supplies such as: "Triple," "Completeo" [fertilizers] and urea etc. Using these, she will reap a better harvest. 

She thanks Afodenic for the support they offer her through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 21 años de edad, y es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante sobre todo porque apoya a sus padres con el fruto de su trabajo. Rosa vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ubicada en la costa sur del Perú y se caracteriza por su clima cálido sus hermosas playas y su gastronomía a base de pescados y mariscos. Rosa no pudo tener una carrera universitaria ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración.
Día a día Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de bazar, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es amable con los clientes y es muy responsable.

Ysabel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un local para su negocio, ya que actualmente no lo tiene, de esta manera ya no pagara alquiler y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 21 years old, she is a young woman with a desire to succeed, above all because she supports her parents with her work. Rosa lives in the city Pisco, on the Southern coast of Peru, that is characterized by its hot climate, its beautiful beaches and its gastronomy based on fish and seafood. Rosa was not able to go to university because her parents had scant economic resources, but she would have liked to have studied administration. Day to day, Rosa works in her small store where she sells bazaar products, among other things. She works around 10 hours a day and she attends to around 20 customers every day. She believes that she is succeeding because she is friendly with her customers and because she is very responsible. 

Ysabel is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva because it is thanks to their support that she will be able to purchase a storefront for her business, because she currently does not have one of her own, and this way she won't have to pay for rent any longer and she will be able to improve her earnings and to continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: to finish building her own home.

loans.use: purchase a storefront.

loans.name: Vebiane

texts.en: Vebiane is a 38-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has seven young children. She raises pigs. She has been raising pigs for almost five years. She applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements, for the pigs to grow healthy in time for sale. Her husband helps sustain the family's expenses by engaging in tuba (coconut wine) vending. In the future, Vebiane would like to expand her pig-raising business to provide her family with proper food and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements for the pigs she raises.

loans.name: Jenily

texts.en: Jenily works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from abaca (hemp) weaving.  Jenily is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Jenily has been maintaining her business activities with her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 19, while the youngest is 4. She operates a welding and vulcanizing business, where she renders vulcanizing and welding services. She has been operating a vulcanizing shop for almost 10 years. She applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy welding rods, vulcanizing materials, and metals, to continue operating her business and to provide her customers with quality service. In the future, Remedios dreams of expanding  her welding and  vulcanizing services and to open up a store for motorcycle parts and, at the same time, to save for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, vulcanizing materials and  metals for her business.

loans.name: Onias

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38-year-old Onias from Bulawayo. He is married with three children and two attending school. He also cares for one dependent. Onias runs a retail business which sells cellphones and accessories, including chargers, pouches, earphones and memory cards. He also sells clothing items, such as kids wear, shoes, and jackets.The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge he faces is competition from bigger retailers who offer credit to customers. Onias has requested a loan of  $500 (USD) to buy more stock and new brands of cellphones for resale. The phones cost between $10 to $200, and can be sold from $15 to as much as $800. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to send his children to better schools, as well as boost his business. In the future, Onias plans to open a big shop in town, selling a variety of electrical gadgets.

loans.use: To buy cellphones, memory cards and other accessories for resale.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children, ages 18 to 30. She has been raising pigs for almost six years now. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and corn. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements to help the pigs grows faster, thus increasing sales. In the future, Ophelia would like to expand her piggery business to support her family and also to finance her children's college education for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplements

loans.name: Faraz

texts.en:
Mr. Faraz is a 25-year-old, young, and energetic man. He has been running a garment shop for seven years. 

He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand his business. Currently, Faraz has a limited stock to offer to his customers. He would use the loan amount to purchase a new variety of garments and, in this way, his sales would be increased. 

Faraz has recently married and he wants to give a peaceful and happy life to his life partner and this loan could help him to fulfill his dreams. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 21 años de edad, y es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante sobre todo porque es madre de 2 pequeños de 2 y 8 años a quienes quiere muchísimo y junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para poder darle una vida digna y con mejores oportunidades. Ysabel vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ubicada en la costa sur del Perú y se caracteriza por su clima cálido sus hermosas playas y su gastronomía a base de pescados y mariscos. Ysabel no pudo tener una carrera universitaria ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser chef ya que ella cocina muy rico.

Día a día Ysabel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de Huevos, con cuyos ingresos la ayudan para apoyar a  su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo no se deja vencer por las adversidades.

Ysabel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un local para su negocio, ya que actualmente no lo tiene, de esta manera ya no pagara alquiler y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Ysabel, 21, is a young woman with a strong wish to get ahead above all because she’s mother of two little ones who are 2 and 8 years of age who she loves very much.  She and her husband work hard to give them a dignified life with better opportunities.  

Ysabel lives in the city of Pisco located on Perú’s southern coast and noted for its hot climate, beautiful beaches and cuisine based on fish and seafood.  Ysabel was unable to go to university because her parents had few resources but she would have liked to study to become a chef because she cooks delicious food.

Ysabel works day to day in her small business selling eggs and her income helps her husband cover household expenses.  She works about 8 hours daily and can take care of up to 20 customers per day.  She believes she’s moving forward because she’s kind to her customers and above all because she doesn’t let adversities defeat her.

Ysabel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a locale for her business because she doesn’t have one at present and in this way she won’t have to pay rental anymore and her income will improve so she will be able to continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy a locale.

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en: Fouzia is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible person, the mother of four children. Her husband owns a card-printing shop, which is the only source of income for his family. Currently they are facing a serious loadshedding (power rationing) problem in the area. Because of that, Fouzia's husband is unable to meet the demands of customers on time in order to generate a good income. He wants to buy a generator for his business, so that he can work easily. For that reason, his wife Fouzia, as a member of two-person group, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of buying a generator. This will help him to meet  the demand from customers on time and continue his work. Note: In the picture, Fouzia is wearing a grey dress and holding a pouch.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her husband's business so that he can continue to meet customer demand in the face of power rationing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fabric for her sewing business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 32-year-old housewife who lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband owns a small hotel in the market, which is the only source of income for their family. He is expert in cooking and his delicious food is liked by everyone. Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will purchase food products including chicken, beef, breads, pulses, vegetables and oil. Shazia wants to save money for her children's education with the profit amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, beef, breads, pulses, vegetables and oil

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  She is from Getafe, Bohol.  She raises pigs, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Merlinda requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and additional piglets and repair the pig pens so they have a comfortable place to live.  In the future, Merlinda would like to expand her piggery business and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and piglets and repair the pig pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Inti Raymi Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Inti Raymi” en la comunidad de Suchubamba. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de frutas, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros. 

María Rosa tiene 44 años de edad y tiene siete hijos, ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, agua y otras cosas. En esta oportunidad María Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografia pidieron permiso para no estar en la reunion y tuvimos que buscarles en sus domicilios). 

(La comunidad de Suchubamba está ubicado en el del distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends form the communal bank "Inti Raymi" in the community of Suchubamba. This communal bank is formed by various people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts to give a better future for their children. The members are dedicated to agricultural work, selling fruit, selling food, selling groceries, raising livestock, making artisanal products, and raising smaller animals, among other activities. 

María Rosa is 44 years old and has seven children. She is a responsible and loving person who pushes her family forward. She was born in the district of Challabamba and she lives in the same district where she was born. She sells basic necessity products like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, bread, sodas, water and other items. With this opportunity, María Rosa needs a loan so she can purchase sacks of rice and sacks of sugar. The members of her group are thankful for the opportunity given them and they promise to complete their re-payments within the established time frame. (The people who appear ar the bottom of the photo asked permission to not be at the meeting and we had to go to their homes to photograph them.)

(The community of Suchubamba is located in the Callabamba district in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cuzco.)

loans.use: purchase sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer valiente y trabajadora, está casada con Max y tiene 6 hijos pero solamente vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia.El trabajo de Maritza consiste en la venta de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas razón por la cual tiene 2 refrigeradoras en su hogar en donde congela a diario todas las bebidas que luego pone a la venta a sus ocasionales clientes. Afortunadamente le va muy bien y sus ventas mejoran con el paso del tiempo.Lleva en este negocio más de 8 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijos mientras su esposo desarrolla otras actividades.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar al lado de sus hijos y disponer del tiempo necesario para realizar otras actividades.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le brindaran para continuar con su negocio ,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.Con el monto solicitado comprará más bebidas para tener en stock  y así poder cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maritza, 49, is a brave, hardworking woman married to Max; she has six children but only two of them live with her in her own house.  Maritza’s work consists in selling beverages like carbonated soft-drinks and beer and to do so she has two refrigerators at home where she freezes the drinks every day to then sell to her occasional customers.  

Fortunately, she does very well and sales have improved as time has passed.  She’s been in this business for more than 8 years and she does so with help from her children while her husband carries out other activities.  What she likes about her work is that she can work alongside her children and have time available to do other activities.

On this occasion she’ll request 1,000 soles.  She feels grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue in business and in addition commits to make her payments punctually and responsibly.  She will use the requested amount to buy more beverages to have in stock to be able to fill customer requests.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages at wholesale.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is from Yerevan where he lives with his parents, grandmother, and sister. He studies at Yerevan State Economic University. Sargis's parents work hard to earn an income and sustain the family's living. Together with his studies, Sargis works at local shop and financially supports his family. Because of high costs, it is very difficult for Sargis to save money for his education. 

Sargis is requesting a loan, which he will use to pay for his university tuition. Completing his education, finding a well paid job, and ensuring a better life for his family are Sargis's goals.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Valientes está en su ciclo número 15 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. El grupo lleva ese nombre ya que todas son muy valientes y se esfuerzan por crecer y mejorar la vida de cada una de las integrantes.
Fatima es una persona trabajadora, que se esfuerza siempre por dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella no quiere que a su familia le falte nada ni que tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Ella se dedica a pintar figuras de yeso para la venta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder seguir con sus ventas y comprar figuras de yeso y pinturas para poder venderlas después. Agradecen por la ayuda que están recibiendo, ya que no solo les servirá a ella sino también a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Valientes" group (Courageous Women in English) is on its fifteenth loan cycle with the women's committee programme, where everyone works hard and helps each other to prosper.

The group carries this name as all its members are very courageous and put in the effort to grow and improve each of their lives.

Fatima is hard-working and makes the effort to give her family what they need.  She does not want her family to be missing anything or to be deprived, like she was.  Fatima makes a living painting plaster figures that she then sells.

She is applying for this loan so as to continue with her sales and to buy plaster figures and paint to later sell.  She is grateful for the help she is receiving.  It will not just be a help to her but to her family as well.

loans.use: to buy plaster figures and paint.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 58 años de edad , es viuda y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia.El trabajo de María consiste en el alquiler de cuartos. Ha establecido en su terreno 7 cuartos que alquila para uso diario, semanal o mensual a precios cómodos. Para la construcción de estas habitaciones contó con el apoyo de su familia quienes le brindan una ayuda desinteresada. Lleva en esta actividad un promedio de 21 años. Ahora se encuentra en pleno acondicionamiento de algunas de las habitaciones y tiene clientes que le pagan puntualmente, algunos de ellos ya viven en sus cuartos permanentemente. Se siente feliz desarrollando su actividad porque generalmente puede recibir ingresos económicos diarios o  mensuales sin realizar esfuerzo alguno, además se siente muy tranquila porque puede colaborar con el sustento de su hogar, espera que le siga yendo bien para que pueda seguir trabajando con tranquilidad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará mallas para cubrir las ventanas de los cuartos que alquila. Asimismo, comprará algunos accesorios de lavatorio y baño para acondicionar otro cuarto.
texts.en:
María, 58, is a widow and has three children only one of which still lives with her in her own house.  María’s work consists in renting rooms.  

She’s built seven rooms on her property that she leases by the day, week or month at affordable prices.  To build the rooms she had support from her family who help her unconditionally.  She’s been in this activity for about 21 years.  

She’s now in the midst of remodeling some of the rooms and she has customers that pay her punctually; some of them live in their rooms permanently.  She feels happy doing this work because she generally earns income daily or monthly without any effort on her part; besides she feels very relaxed because she can contribute to her home’s support.  She hopes that she’ll continue to do well so that she can continue working in peace.

On this occasion she’ll request 1,000 soles and she’s grateful for the financial support she gets to continue with her work.  She will use the requested amount to buy wire screens to cover the windows of the rooms she leases as well as some bathroom and toilet accessories to equip another room.

loans.use: to buy window screens and bathroom accessories.

loans.name: Alyah

texts.en:
Alyah is a 47-year-old, married woman, living with her husband and six children. She cooperates financially with her husband and children to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 

She has owned a fruits and vegetables shop since 2011. Her shop is situated next to her house where she welcomes customers from different areas and villages to buy her fresh goods. 

Today, Alyah is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her store’s inventory. She states that the loan will certainly help her extend her trade and increase her income by a large percentage. 

In the future, Alyah plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in  Punjab, Pakistan. He is an honest and hardworking business man. Ali has been running a cloth shop for two years. All the people in his area know him very well and are satisfied with his services. 

Ali is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy a new variety of cloth to sell as he has a limited stock to offer for customers. He believes the added stock will increase his sales. With the help of this loan, he can expand his business resulting in an increase in his net income and savings. 

Ali wants the bright future of his child. With the profit, he would pay the educational expenses of his child.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of cloth

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel,  tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 25 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo de dos años. El se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y lleva diez años de desempeñarlo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas insecticidas, semilla y asimismo adquirir una novilla; este le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is 32-years-old, married and his wife’s 25-years-old; he’s happy to have a two-year-old son.  He works in agriculture and animal husbandry, an occupation he learned from his parents; he’s been doing it for ten years.

The loan he needs will make it possible for him to buy manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide, seeds and also to buy a heifer.  This will help him increase inventory and earn higher income.  His dream is to strengthen the business and offer his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and a heifer.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio tiene 63 años de edad y es viudo. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura pues él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra y cosecha de yuca, plátano, piña, arroz y tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

Ignacio vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Ignacio is 63-years-old and a widower.  His main economic activity is agriculture since he has several parcels of land where he grows and harvests manioc, bananas, pineapples and rice; he also raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  He’s been working in agriculture for many years and he does well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He’s an enterprising, hardworking man who belongs to the “Paititi” communal bank.  On this occasion he needs the loan to buy manure and fertilizer.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments.  Ignacio lives in the city of Pilcopata.  The city of Pilcopata is located in Kosñipata District inside Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Perú.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 52 años de edad y es separado de su pareja. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros más, pero también vende verduras y frutas en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Pilcopata. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

Mariano vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mariano is 52 and separated from his wife. His main activity is selling basic food items such as rice, sugar, and noodles, but he also sells vegetables and fruits at one of the popular city markets in Pilcopata. He has several years of experience in this business, which is prospering because of his efforts. 

He is an enterprising and hardworking member of the communal bank Paititi. He now needs a loan to buy vegetables and fruits. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make his monthly payments. Mariano lives in the city of Pilcopata, located in the Kosñipata district in Paucartambo province of the department of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children.The oldest is 35, while the youngest is six. 

Marcela engages in a fish-vending business. She sells fish, crabs, and clams to customers in her community. She has been into fish-vending for almost six years now. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells her husband's catch.

Marcela requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fishing net. In the future, Marcela would like to expand her business to support her family and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Judith Margaret

texts.es:
Judith es una joven e 19 años de edad, vive al lado de su madre en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. Judith es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que a pesar de las adversidades sigue adelante. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Judith solo puedo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Administración.

Día a día Judith trabaja como vendedora en una ferretería de su distrito y con el fruto de su trabajado apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar; Judith cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene mucha fe en que todo va mejorar para ella y su familia.

Judith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá ayudar a su madre en la compra de una prótesis dental, ya que debido a un accidente, tiene la necesidad de usar la prótesis, de esta manera Judith ayudara a su madre a mejorar la salud y ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y sacar adelante a su familia”.
texts.en:
Judith’s a young 19-year-old living with her mother in Parcona District, Ica, Perú.  Judith’s a young woman who very much wants to get ahead which is why she continues forward despite adversities.  Because of her limited economic resources, Judith was only able to complete fifth grade in secondary school but would have liked to have studied Business Administration.

Day to day Judith works as a salesperson in a hardware store in her district and with the fruits of her labor helps her mother with household expenses.  Judith believes she’s moving forward because she’s responsible and has much faith that everything will improve for her and her family.

Judith is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to help her mother buy a dental prosthesis because due to an accident she needs to wear a prosthetic device.  In this way Judith will help her mother improve her health and she will continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to study a university career and move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy a prosthetic device.

loans.name: Wajdi

texts.en:
Wajdi is 27 years old and single. He has been working as a blacksmith for the past six years. He has one part-time employee. 

In order to improve his business operations and provide his customers with better quality of services, Wajdi is requesting a youth loan from Vitas s.a.l, which he will use to purchase equipment and supplies. Wajdi is an optimistic and ambitious person who always seeks the best; he is doing well in his professional career to progress and increase his financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Marlen Janet

texts.es:
Marlen Janet es originaria del municipio de Achuapa pero actualmente habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde labora como profesora de secundaria, vive al lado de sus dos hijas las que están en edad escolar.

 A pesar de ser madre soltera les da lo que puede bajo sus posibilidades con su bajo salario pero sobre todo amor y educación.

Con los préstamos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel con los fondos de los inversionistas de Kiva inició a construir su propia casa ya que desde que es madre alquila vivienda por lo que uno de sus grandes sueños es llegar a tener su propia casa y dejarles a sus hijas un hogar propio para ellas, lo que agradece en gran magnitud por este apoyo incondicional.

Hoy en la actualidad necesita el crédito para realizarse un trabajo en los dientes y por lo tanto mejorarlos y espera que sigan apoyando a esta humilde maestra.
texts.en:
Marlen Janet is originally from Achuapa but currently lives in El Sauce, where she works as a secondary school teacher.  She lives with her two school-aged daughters.  Even though she is a single mother, she gives them what she can with her low salary, above all love and education.

She used the loans from Ceprodel, with funds from Kiva lenders, to build a home of her own because she used to rent and one of her greatest dreams was to have a home of her own so she can provide a proper home for her daughters.  She greatly appreciates this support.

Now she needs a loan to have some dental work done and she hopes that you will continue to support this humble teacher.

loans.use: to have some dental work done.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decisión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión está formado por  11 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tienen muchos lugares para visitar y disfrutar momentos amenos con la familia.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth Esperanza, se encuentra en el banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión desde hace 8 años, en todo este tiempo ha logrado formar una familia en su banco comunal, le gusta los créditos porque le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica.

La Señora. Ruth Esperanza tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en un colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una mecánica automotriz, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Ruth Esperanza trabaja de lunes a sábados un local que venden ramos de flores para toda ocasión, esta en este trabajo desde hace algunos años. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar y para pagar los estudios de sus hijos. 

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres con Decisión comprises 11 women, who engage in various activities to improve their household finances and to support their families. They live in the outlying areas of Cuenca, which is the country's third most important city and a World Heritage Site since December 1999. The city has many places to visit where you can have fun with your family.

Ruth Esperanza has been a member of Mujeres con Decisión for eight years, and, during this time, the communal bank has become family to her. She likes the loans because they improve her financial stability. Ruth Esperanza, 39, is married and has three children, ages 17, 14, and 8, from the relationship. The two oldest children are in high school, and the youngest attends a small school in the city. Her husband is an auto mechanic, and they live in their own house.

For several years, Ruth Esperanza has worked Monday to Saturday in a florist shop, where they sell flowers for all occasions. She will use the loan to buy groceries and to pay for her children's education. Her dream is to be debt free.

loans.use: to buy groceries and to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa está en su ciclo número 15ª del programa de comité de mujeres,  ellas son conocidas en el barrio porque siempre trabajan juntas y se ayudan las unas a las otras, son muy unidas y han luchado ciclo a ciclo, todo esto por dar a sus familias todo lo que merecen.
Mirian es parte de este grupo, es la presidenta, y cuenta que todas ellas son madres de familia, que luchan por ayudar a sus familias, y de esa forma que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar. Ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza y allí trabaja todos los días muy sacrificadamente. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que quiere crecer y salir adelante.
Mirian solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, gel, spray y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y dando a sus clientes el buen servicio al que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa is in cycle 15 in the women’s committee program.  They are well-known in the neighborhood because they always work together and help each other out; they are very united and have striven cycle to cycle in order to give their families everything they deserve.

Mirian’s part of this group; she’s the president and she relates that all of them are mothers who strive for their families so that they won’t have to go through the same kind of needs they themselves had to go through.  She has a small beauty salon where she works hard every day.  She defines herself as a person who wants to grow and get ahead.

Mirian’s requesting a loan to buy hair color, shampoo, rinses, gel, spray and other supplies to continue with her work and providing the good service her customers have become accustomed to.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Aty 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Caaguazú, 16 mujeres se han unido para trabajar juntas, ayudarse y poder salir adelante por medio del esfuerzo de cada una. Son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron luchar y poner todo de si para salir adelante.
La Sra. Elida es una de las integrantes, tiene una despensa anexo mercería y cuenta que su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y así poder mejorar su local. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones vaya mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
